Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Genken3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend July 2011. The location is fantastic, you can walk everywhere! Close to all the main sites as well a spectacular little piazzas and cute streets you will just run into! The service was great, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with booking tours. The breakfast was great, a lot to choose from. The rooms are clean and we had a great view over via de corso, busy street but could not here the traffic! Definitely will stay here a again, not too expensive, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Trevor F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of March 2012 the loctaion is great no problem getting to all the tourist areas. Used the city tour bus for the Vatican so as far as sight seeing is concerned it is an excellent loctation. Some down sides were that we booked the hotel understanding it had a bar and roof terrace however on arrival we were informed that the bar and the terrace were shut. On some days there was a slight sewerage smell in the bathroom.But the room was clean and tidy. But there was some nice restraunts around the area just out of the hotel and turn right then right again you come to the Taverna del Seminario a great place and reasonably priced. We did have an early tour one day and asked at the front desk about a packed lunch, we were told that they are not available, but managed to get some fruit from the nice lady who was up early prepering breakfast next morning. Friday morning the staff must finish early because they certainly started early and were not partculary quite holding a conversation in the corridor next to our room, I think the maintenace man must have strted early as well by the sounds of the hammering further down the coridor.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in excellent locations for all the tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: marinablue
Reviews.Content: My elderly friend and I booked this hotel via a British Airways flight and hotel package at a very good price for a four night stay with breakfast, in two single rooms. Having read the reviews and done our homework, we knew that Hotel Regno was going to be a good basic, traditional Rome hotel without any frills, very centrally located. So our expectations about the hotel were realistic from the outset and consequently my review is based on how much (little) we paid for our accommodation. Previous comments about how well this hotel is located and very convenient for walking to most of the major sites were correct, as were the comments about the street noise late at night if your rooms overlook the main or side streets. But, hey ho, at the price of the rooms, which in fact turned out to be small doubles and not singles, who is complaining about street noise. Also, we two ladies feel quite safe walking around the local streets and piazzas at night because of the buzz all around. But we did hold on tight to our handbags, just in case…... and we needed our comfortable shoes because of all the old cobblestones in the centro storico Breakfast was a more than adequate, basic Italian continental breakfast, although you could pay a few euros extra for boiled or scambled eggs. Their black Americano coffee was the best hotel coffee I have ever tasted. And it was nice that they supplied you each with a pot each from which you could get about 3 cups. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and neat and quite characterful. I only had a very small shower in my small bathroom. My friend’s room was larger and her bathroom had a bath and overhead shower. The maids made up the rooms daily whilst we were at breakfast which was very efficient. There was plenty of wardrobe space and hangers. We were very fortunate to have wonderful weather for the 5 days we were there and so this made walking to the sites, even to St Peter’s at about 35 minutes away, very enjoyable. A stop on the way back in the beautiful Piazza Navona for a beer, yes is expensive, but you get a little bowl of crisps and a few mini sandwiches included. It is lovely just to sit back and people watch. We booked transfers with Rome Cabs to/from the airport before we left home over the internet. We did not have to leave credit card details or pay a deposit in advance. At 50 euros per transfer, you pay about 10 euros extra than for a basic white fiat taxi cab from the airport to the hotel. But you get helpful details emailed to you like a youtube link which shows where to meet your Rome Cab driver at the airport, what to do if your flight is delayed and a big comfy, air conditioned limousine Mercedes, a lovely way to start and finish your Roman holiday. There was one thing at Hotel Regno that slightly marred our stay. After breakfast on our last day, I left in my room a 10 euro note tip for the maid and a wrapped gift that I was taking with me, whilst I went downstairs to pay the mini bar and tax bills and to leave my case. I returned to my room less than 10 minutes later to find the money and gift missing, but almost immediately a strange man, who I had never seen before, knocked at the door and thrust the gift back at me, but not the 10 euros. I was somewhat taken aback. I know I should have complained at reception but I let it go. It was unsettling as this man (who was not the guy who helps take the luggage to rooms or any others whom I had seen working there during my stay) must have been watching out for me to leave my room. He must have had an entry card and made a grab for anything left out for the maids before they did the room. He obvious was not expecting me to return to my room, even though at the time my elderly friend was still in hers next to mine. So make sure you lock up your cases and do not leave anything lying around in your room that could be pinched whilst you are out of it at any time. I wonder if he makes a habit of this?

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: The location is great! We walked everywhere from the hotel. The street where it is located has great shopping and is so close to the sights you want to see. They have red flags out in front of the hotel & that helped us find it as we learned our way around the city. The staff is very helpful & friendly. As soon as we checked in, we realized that while traveling, we had lost an item we needed & the staff quickly helped us resolve this problem. Based on reviews- we were expecting a tiny room but were given a 2 room suite with 2 bathrooms & a balcony. Great fluffy towels and towel warmer in bathroom. It was hot and they said AC was not yet turned on- had to sleep with windows open-- although we faced the side alley- it was really noisy for much of the evening & the noise started again in the early morning. Breakfast was just fair & hot water for tea was just warm. We loved our room & appreciated how friendly/helpful the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Pofoodies
Reviews.Content: Great location!! Rooms were small but adequate, however one in our group booked single. this is like the cupboard under the stairs!! In our double room shower was a problem, as it flooded bathroom; due to a design fault, breakfast was good and the location is magic. we love Rome, could recomend regno due to location as a great value hotel, would definitely book this area for any hotel if looking at pantheon, Trevi fountain or Piazza Navona etc

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.......and some!”
Reviews.Author: Sue T
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay in the wonderful city of Rome, made unforgettable by staying in this little gem of a place. The location is unbeatable in my opinion.....literally around the corner from The Trevi Fountain and The Pantheon, tourist information across the road, buses a stones throw, and all the other glorious sights within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is extremely clean and comfortable and every single member of staff we came across was polite, welcoming and friendly. The breakfast bar has a good choice and you can pay just a couple of euros extra for a cooked breakfast if you haven't overdosed on the wonderful Italian cuisine just outside the door! Would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel to all and hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to explore the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: DavidC55
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was situated on the Via del corso which is right where you want to be to explore this stunning city. We were only a few minutes from the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain so everything was within easy reach. We could walk to the colusium and Piaza novona. I would say the best time of year to go is early or late summer as it can get very hot there. You can see it all from foot but buses are easy to catch. You have to buy your ticket from the tabac which are everywhere so no problem there. This city is stunning with so much to soo and it's a place for romantics to enjoy but like all major cities it's very expensive but if you allow for that it won't be a shock. The hotel was clean but small and the rooms were tiny as was the bath. I have no idea how you could actually take a bath but it was ok to shower in. The hotel is no thrills but it was fine for a place to rest your tired feet at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: triple7
Reviews.Content: As previously reported the best aspect of this hotel is its location, just a 5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. The Vatican can be walked in about 30mins the Colosseum about 20mins. On our three night break we walked everywhere from this hotel. The main Rail/Bus station can be walked to in about 40mins. The hotel supplied us with a map that was easy to use. On our first night we had a first floor room that was street facing this room was unbearably hot with the airconditiong turned off there was still hot air blowing from the outlet, we opened the windows but the noise from the street was excessive. The next morning we asked to change rooms and was given a room on the fith floor at the back of the hotel this room was cool and quite. The Reception staff were very helpful and polite. Bathrooms are very compact and the shower heads in our two rooms were positioned in a strange position hence difficult to keep the water in the bath tub and not on the floor. That said this is a nice little hotel and we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely recommend to friends!”
Reviews.Author: Steph B
Reviews.Content: Booked with BA Holidays - really good value for flights and hotel. The location of the Regno is brilliant with many sights within walking distance or easy to get to by bus (stops virtually outside the door). Also a wide selection of good-value eateries in the side-streets between Via del Corso and the Pantheon. I would agree with other reviewers that rooms at the front can be noisy. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful - much better than relying on guide-books!

Reviews.Title: “well situated”
Reviews.Author: dianehaz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regno is very well situated, very close to the Trevi Fountain and Temple Adriano, the Pantheon is about a 10 minute walk and the Vatican City takes about 40 minutes. All the streets are cobbled so wear sensible shoes. I was a bit disappointed with the Hotel facilities, no tea or coffee in bedroom, or snack bar/restaurant and there is no roof terrace, it is now bedrooms. There are plenty of restaurants about, always order what is on the menu, otherwise they will make up a ridiculous price. We went with guides around the Vatican and the Collosseum, they where very good, got you in alot quicker and gave you all the information you need. Our guide around the Palantino and around the city at night was John Sebastiano, he was english but lived in Rome, he was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: We visited Hotel Regno in 2010 for our 25th Anniversary, had a wonderful experience. We returned again in February 2012, and we were treated like old friends returning for another visit. Everyone was so friendly, and helpful. The Hotel is also located in walking distance to most of the major sites. A large selection of restaurants to choose from, within walking distance. A true pleasure to stay at the Hotel Regno, we highly recommend them to all! Jim and Mary R.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Central Hotel, Avoid Rooms at The Front.”
Reviews.Author: BondNic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package through BA ( flights and hotel) and were not disappointed. Perfect location, walked to most of the sights or took the bus. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. The room was lovely and clean and a reasonable size however.... it was at the front of the hotel, the room was hot hot hot (even with the heating turned off) which meant having to open the windows, the room overlooked the main street which was incredibly noisy so you could either sweat the night away with the windows closed or open the windows but not get much sleep. It is a great hotel just make sure you don't get a room overlooking the front of the hotel. The breakfast was lovely although on more than one occasion we had to wait for a table to become free as it was very busy. The breakfast room is tiny, maybe this is something they could improve on. Would I go back? Yes but I would request a room at the back of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Oshitmoguls
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and friendly service. Breakfast well above italian average. Room was large by european standards we had a Balconny facing via del corso.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Hotel, brill location”
Reviews.Author: Ladybear66
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Rome and stopped at this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, wasn't disappointed at all. When we arrived the room wasn't quite ready so they gave us a free drink of coffee. When we were shown our room we were lucky enough to have a separate sitting room with a telly, plus 2 balcony's, small bathroom, but very clean. The breakfast was the usual continental, various cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit, selection of meats, cheeses, cold pizza and a large variety of different bread and cobs. The staff was helpful on the desk and gave us a map of the area and pointed us in the right direction to the sights. My only fault with the hotel is that when we had been out all day we couldn't get a hot drink when we got back to the hotel as the snack bar was closed(probably out of season, but saying that the hotel was full) and there were no facilities in the room. The hotel is brilliantly located only a few minutes away from Trevi Fountain, which is across the road and down the side street and the Pantheon is a few minutes down back of the hotel. It is about a 10 min walk to the Colosseo (we got a ticket which also included visiting Palatino Hill for 12 euro and was valid for 2 days bargain). Eating out is not cheap, (wondered why the queues for Macdonalds were so long when we first arrived), we did find a couple of chinese's which were reasonably priced, they did sell the cheapest beer, otherwise a pint of lager ranged from 8 euro up to 11 euro, shorts were 8 euros also. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central location 100 m from pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: Bigsexytoohotty
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Not overly fancy. Small ( short) bed and tiny LCD but hey you don't go to Rome to sleep and watch tv. Great breakfast each morning . Located about half way between Trevi fountain and pantheon. Only slight negative was that hotel is about 2 km from station, but bus stops right outside. Like many places in Rome, had that weird sewer smell sometimes. Still trying to work that one out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holly B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and found the hotel and location excellent. The price was reasonable for the location and the room was very clean and had everything I needed. The only (small) negative was that the breakfast wasn't amazing, it was ok but the bread was quite hard and when I ordered a cup of tea on both mornings it was luke warm. But other than that it was superb, as others have said the location is brilliant and I was able to walk everywhere with the Trevi Fountain just minutes away!

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, could improve”
Reviews.Author: 0Odisseus
Reviews.Content: The rooms in February were rather cold, the AC was difficult to configure (the porter tried to show us how but clearly didn't know himself) and the fan was quite noisy. The rooms/ bathrooms could do with some deep-cleaning or even refurbishing. Breakfast served in a small section on the 1st floor offers mostly miniature chocolate muffins, some yogurt, nice rosette bread, cooked ham and cheese. Not great for Rome, where you'd expect fresh cornetti alla crema. Stay away from the Ribena-like fruit juices. The cappuccino is also on the cold side of tepid, albeit quite frothy. This sounds like a bad review, but the rooms are actually nice, the staff at reception helpful and the location perfect. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaners ho through luggage and steal, rooms smell of sewage.”
Reviews.Author: Monkeybear123
Reviews.Content: Our suitcases were clearly rifled through and my duty free Chanel perfume was stolen by the cleaner during our week long stay at this hotel. The room smelt strongly of sewage, the smell emanating through the bath plug and toilet. While this hotel is undeniably in a fantastic location, I would never in a million years stay here again. There are plenty of other hotels nearby - stay there instead and avoid coming back to a smelly room that has been cased by the cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: kerry m
Reviews.Content: We booked through BA Flight & Hotel - arranged for the Hotel to pick us up (cheaper than BA) 50Euro to met by a lovely man in a merc who gave us a guided tour and local knowledge for the 50 minute drive to the Hotel. The staff there are great and very helpful. Loads of food at breakfast, the room was small but we were hardly in it as there is so much to do in Rome and when we were in the room we slept in what must have been a Queen size bed. (pillows a bit hard, you might want to take your own!) The room was cleaned spotlessly everyday, there really is nothing bad to say about this Hotel. Its location is FIRST CLASS, right by the sights you'd want to see and within walking distance of everywhere you'd want to go. If you want to stay in Rome for a decent price dont look anywhere else - honestly. We stayed in January and had the most amazing weather, clear skies the entire time, tshirt weather in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: BellaH_Surrey
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and the location was absolutely fantastic! Every site was within walking distance and there were lots of shops and restaurants nearby to choose from. Our room upon arrival was on the small side but as soon as a larger room became available staff were happy to move us. Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was plentiful, although sometimes the breakfast room was a bit busy and difficult to get a seat. The only downside I would say is that there is no bar at the hotel or tea and coffee facilities in the rooms; however on the whole a fantastic place to stay and I will certainly stay again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Larry T
Reviews.Content: There was a massive number of hotels in Rome to choose from and we got lucky on our first trip to Rome. We had an excellent room with a balcony overlooking the Christmas-lit street. It was clean, comfortable, and reasonably priced. The staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was excellent. We walked to the Roman Forum, the Coloseum, Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and other highlights. We were there for three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ChristineConstantino
Reviews.Content: I think that I am repeating everything that everyone else is saying but the location of this hotel can not be beaten. The Trevi fountain is a 3 min walk. The pantheon is a 5 min walk. The furthest place was the Vatican and that was a 20 min leisurely walk. We were here for five days and never used any form of transport. If I had to be negative I'd say that our room was a bit small and could have done with tea making facilities in our room. The staff were polite and friendly. Finally for those who can't live without the Internet they have free 24 hour wifi. And for those how do not want to bring computers etc they have a computer with printer in a reception area on floor one. Thank you all at the hotel Regno

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jodie R
Reviews.Content: First time i had been to Rome. Location of this hotel is excellant. Very clean, big rooms, ok breakfast very continental and no tea or coffee facilities in bedroom. My partner had been to Rome before and said that the location of this hotel is the best. Pleasant and helpful staff. We had a room at the front of this hotel, if you are a light sleeper like me i found it a bit noisy with the electric buses that seem to run all night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Leatherman
Reviews.Content: We booked through BA and pre paid so rate was great. Walk to every attraction, seriously. The location cannot be touched. Very clean, nice breakfast, OK bed, small bath (it's Roma!), tiny lobby. We had a front room with tiny veranda for people watching. This place is not a four star but just great. This is a perfectly fine place and we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bertiebuttons
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor we chose Hotel Regno. We are so glad we did. The hotel could not be in a better location and for the 4 days we stayed there, we explored the entire city without using any public transport. We had stayed in room 450 which was considerably larger than we expected, which had a balcony. The room was double glazed and noise was kept down to a minimum. The breakfast was very good as well. We plan to stay there again on ouir next visit to a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, there is nothing more to ask for on a holiday”
Reviews.Author: rianjdeus
Reviews.Content: I had been to rome earlier on business but this was the first time i had been on a holiday with my family and my friends. We were debating quite a bit before the holiday on whether this was a right choice or not. However we were happy that the room was good on the 5th floor with a nice little balcony facing the via del corso. The hotel room was spacious and better than many hotels i had stayed in milan & rome. The best part of the hotel is the location and all the main siteseeing locations are just walking distances. And if you can strech a bit and walk for 20mn or so then u can reach even the vatican and castel sant'angelo as well. And within few meters, you have the pantheon, trevi fountain, spanish steps, colesseum, Piazza Venezia,Piazza de popolo etc.., we have done most of siteseeing walking around and the staff are quite friendly and do help. And my 4year daughter wanted to go the Mcdonalds as usual and the best part was it was also just 20meters away from the hotel as well. You could do loads of shopping on the via del corso on the way to piazza de popolo. I have been recommending all my friends to stay at this hotel for thier holiday at rome.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the best-located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shortbreak_Dave
Reviews.Content: Rome is a city for doing on foot and the great sights are nearly all outdoors - and the Regno couldn't be better to facilitate it. Lots of people have mentioned how close the Trevi and Pantheon are on either side (with the Spanish Steps and Piazza Navonna not too much further) but a couple of minutes up the street is the Marcus Aurealis column and not very far the Piazza del Popolo and the Villa Borghese park. Down the street a couple of minutes you're at Pizza Venezia and right in front of you il Vittoriana. After that, another 10-15 mintes you're down to the Colisseum and the Forum. Apart from that, excellent breakfast to fuel you. Staff helpful and friendly. Rooms fine - a tiny bit cold (but there are extra blankets in the cupboards to sort that).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 930turbo
Reviews.Content: First vsist to Rome and could not have picked a better location to stay. Easy walking distance to all major sights in Rome. Rooms not big but very comfortable and clean. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We stayed here 3 times during our month in Italy and each time looked forward to coming back. Free Wifi but some rooms not serviced so had to go to the guest lounge or even just out if the hallway at times to get a signal, but no big deal and all part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rome November 2011”
Reviews.Author: Dkerr_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 13th of November for four nights. Brilliant location - close to the Pantheon, Trevi fountain, shops, restaurant and a little market on the other side of via del corsa. We had bed and breakfast - there was tea, coffee, fruit juice, cereal, bread, rolls, cold meats, cheese, yogurt and fresh fruit - no cooked option - but it was ample. There was no bar but a lounge was available with wifi and a pc. The room itself was very comfortable - nice comfy bed - the BBC news chanel and CNN were the only chanels in english. I would stay here again but would ask for a different room next time. We were in room 242 (second floor) and even with the windows closed there was considerable noise from the street below (one night an opera singer was performing for the restaurant down below! he was good! )and we could hear our neighbous chatting. However all in all we enjoyed our stay here and the weather was fantasic - clear blue skys every day.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_traveller_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has about the best location in Rome. Approximately 5 minutes in one direction to the Pantheon ,a similiar distance in the other direction to the Trevi Fountain and surrounded by restaurants to suit all price ranges. The hotel lobby is small and unimpressive but our room was a good size and very clean with a balcony overlooking the Via del Corso. The bathroom was very modern and had a retractable clothes line in the shower recess which was very useful. The breakfast is quite a good spread of fruit juice, fruit, meat, cheese bread yoghurt pastries etc and coffee or tea made to order ( rather than left to stew on a hot plate). Free wifi or paid internet via a terminal were available but only on the first floor. The staff were helpful without being effusive. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and in a safe location. Location was PERFECT! Close to everything you would want to see in Rome. Our room was nice and clean! The breakfast was amazing and fresh! The only complaint was the service. They were not too friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding situation for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: joss1085
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for half term ( british) for 3 nights. The situation of the hotel on Via del Corso is outstanding with everything ( including the Vatican) with walking distance. The staff were great and the quality of the rooms excellent. The forum is less than 10 minutes. On one side of the road is the Pantheon and piazza Navonna and over the road is the trevi fountain and the Spanish steps you could not ask for a better situated hotel ( my third time to Rome). The breakfasts are very good and you can fill up for the day ( unless you have teenage kids of course). Air con in the rooms and despite being in the fron of the hotel it was very quiet at night with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, No air-con!”
Reviews.Author: JHoop81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regno from Monday 24th-Thursday 27th. Postitives: The hotels location is perfect, slap bang in the middle of the city and walking distance from many of the big tourist attractions and many restaurants and cages etc. The rooms were very clean and we had free wii-fii available which helped when researching thugs to do in Rome. The beds were comfortable, big plasma TVs and a good breakfast selection. Not so postives: No air-con! The hotel is advertised as having it but we were quickly told that it wasn't working in any room in the hotel. Unfortunately when we arrived we quickly realised that our room was facing the main street, which had road works going on right outside our window for virtually the entire night, every night. We were left with two options-sleep with the window open so we could have some fresh air, but then lay awake due to the very loud noise, or keep the windows shut but literally sweat to death because it was so hot in the rooms. I know the hotel can't control the road works but we should have been advised that the air con would not be available as this led to 3 pretty poor nights sleep and this did impact on the day times too! Staff were not overly friendly and gave us some incorrect information about where to get busses from (not a major issue but frustrating none the less), said there was nothing they could do to help us out regarding sleep concerns! No fans available, no other rooms etc. Shower was tiny and there was no bath (again no biggy but why does the website say each room has a bath?) I would stay here again but I would first make sure the air-con was fully functioning and would not completely trust everything they say on their website.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: colinwilcox1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent three nights in the hotel Regno it was our first visit to Rome. The room was comfortable and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good with cereals fruit meat cheese rolls etc. Plenty to choose from. The central location meant we could walk to all the places we wanted to visit. Rome is a wonderful place to visit and the location meant we could go back for a rest for a couple of hours and then continue exploring .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne462
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Rome for a week to celebrate our wedding anniversary and what a fantastic time we had. We arrived at the hotel after dark and were made very welcome immediately by the reception staff. We had requested a room with a balcony but none were available on our first night. However, our luggage was moved to one the following morning for the rest of our stay. Nice sized room, well furnished with comfortable double bed, clean bathroom with good shower. Great buffet breakfast with friendly service and the location couldn't be better. On our first night we wandered around the corner looking for a restaurant (and there are plenty close at hand) and heard the sound of water. We had our first meal overlooking the Trevi Fountain! The location of the hotel means that most of the sights are within easy walking distance but for Vatican City we were advised to take the No. 62 bus from right outside the hotel (1 euro each and tickets can be bought from Information Kiosk opposite the hotel). Don't forget to wear comfortable shoes as you will walk miles every day discovering new sights around every corner. Our week in Rome surpassed our expectations and we would definitely recommend the Regno to anyone who wants to be in the heart of the city in a comfortable value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: zanzara64
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located on the Via del Corso, is in the center of many sites that first-time visitors to Rome would like to see. It is within walking distance of the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Forum, Colosseum and Spanish Steps to name a few. The rooms are quiet, even when they face the street, and very clean. It is near restaurants of every type and price range and the staff are very helpful when they give directions. The continental breakfast buffet was very good and the breakfast room is nicely decorated. The service in the breakfast room was good. In a building very near, some great pizza and grilled sandwiches are available at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: MelbournePoppy023
Reviews.Content: The room was great, very clean and comfortable with (small) bathroom and separate toilet, good furnishings and lovely bathroom amenities in a little chiffon bag. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, particularly on our last day when we were heading off to get the bus to the train station, until they told us there was a bus strike - so they managed to get a taxi for us! The location is fantastic on the Via del Corso, within walking distance of so many of the main sights such as the Colosseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. Breakfast was good with excellent coffee and delicious bread rolls and other goodies and you can order eggs for a very small additional payment - the lady working (very hard!) at breakfast was wonderful -very friendly and helpful. We were very happy with this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 112Margaret
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Regno in Rome. The location of the hotel is outstanding, its located on via del corso, which is in the heart of Rome-walking distance to all the major tourist attractions, only 100 metres from the trevi fountain. The shopping on via del corso is fantastic and the hotel Regno is also surrounded by lots of trattoria's, bars and gelatoria's. The Hotel Regno has a nice decor, we stayed in the family room and the four of us slept comfortably each night-it was quiet with an ample size bathroom. The staff are polite and friendly and are always eager to help with directions. Breakfast was fresh and ample, coffee was great and we all really enjoyed our time at the Hotel Regno. I would definetly recommend the Hotel Regno in Rome to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and wonderful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Laguna5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews and I was not disappointed. 3 adults traveling together. The triple room was well sized (for Europe). The location is just brilliant. Steps from the Trevi and all other major spots. Great restaurants nearby. The best part was the lovely welcoming and helpful staff. In particular the breakfast ladies!! I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great position!”
Reviews.Author: Abdan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position, few minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. Room and bathroom were large with a little balcony overlooking the rooftops of Rome at the back of the hotel. Very clean and comfortable and friendly reception staff. Breakfast had good variety and there was plenty of it, certainly enough to keep you going to lunchtime. Would definitely recommend this hotel. There is a great restaurant called Sabatini's in the nearby St Ignatious Square. Definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful breakfast, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Josie_Jo_Aus
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights in a quad room for 2 adults and two children aged 7 and 10. After an overnight flight from Singapore we arrived tired and hungry and the staff kindly offered for us to join the guests in the breakfast room even though we weren't due to book-in until 2 pm. This was an absolute blessing as it gave us the energy to wander off to admire the Trevi fountain and Colosseum before lunch. We mostly ate in the streets between the hotel and Pantheon and every meal was fablous. Would absolutely stay here again. The room was plenty big enough and the bathroom was huge! The kids really looked forward to the buffet breakfast each morning which was extremely filling! They especially enjoyed the hot chocolates served in jugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RichardHawkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my girlfriends birthday on 6th August for two nights. We had a 5th floor room facing the main road. The room was spacious. It had a small balcony and we took the 1 chair from the room + stool from the bathroom and sat out drinking champagne in the sun. Interestingly we thought there was a roof top area with bar, but when we tried to access it, it was closed. I enquired at reception but they said it was just a normal roof and not open. We did not notice any street noise with the windows shut and both slept well. The breakfast was nearly finished on the Sunday so there was not a lot of choice left when we got there, slightly better on the Monday but we did not starve. There was free internet on the 1st floor via a code you got from reception. The only problem we had was that I had taken a birthday cake for us to eat. We ate half and then covered the remaining half with a carrier bag and left it on the hotel tray along with our candles and plastic champagne glasses. We came back after our day out the next day with coffee ready to finish off the cake, only to find it had vanished. Long story short the chamber maid had thrown it out and taken our candles and glasses. Eventually we got our glasses back as luckily she had taken them to the bar. We felt the hotel might have done something like got some more cake for us, and the guy behind the reception the next day asked if we wanted something to replace it but we were checking out by then. The man on the night before whilst appologising did not offer anything. Still the night before he had been very helpful, lending me money to go the tabac shop to buy matches to light the birthday cake as the hotel did not have any (this saved me a trip back up in the lift to get my money). But despite the cake saga it was still a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saul552
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us very well, right across the street from a bus stop and within walking distance of many attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful, giving us restaurant recommendations, directions, and advice about what to do. The breakfast was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great position in central Rome..helpful staff...scrumptious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maabs
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in central Rome in Via del corso and you can walk to all attractions from here...the Trevi fountain is around the corner and the other main attractions in CBD very close by...There are lots of cafes, restaurants and shops all close by and if you prefer the buses and trains are easily accessible nearby...Our room was on the smallish size but very clean and functional.The room was cleaned everyday if you liked and the breakfast buffet was scrumptious with plenty to eat and great staff...You have free wifi on level one , you just have to get a code from the reception to access it everyday. The staff at reception were good and answered all questionIf you hire a car make sure it has GPS as the streets in Rome are crazy and you will get lost!!

Reviews.Title: “Centered in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Punditalia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regno is a small hotel at the midpoint of the Via del Corso, as central and convenient a location as any in Rome. It's located in what were two adjacent buildings and access to some of the rooms is unusual in that the corridors are interrupted by winding stairs connecting the diverse levels of the original buildings. We had a problem with this as there was a baby with carriage etc. in our party. The friendly and helpful desk staff resolved this quickly by moving the baby and parents to a room on the same level as the elevator landing. Our room was a small suite, nicely furnished, and with a very inviting balcony. Breakfast was large by Italian standards, though not the feast that some American and German travelers expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Mars2611
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in absolutely great location! We stayed in comfortable triple room, with a little balcony, just gorgeous. Very well soundproofed as it was noisy outside. Good buffet breakfast, internet available and tourist information. Gabriele was helpful and fantastic to deal with before and during our stay - thankyou,thankyou. Would love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in wonderful central location so you can walk to all the sight. Small and basic room but everything you need in a city. Breakfast was fantastic and the staff were really friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sequoia-design
Reviews.Content: Very small room. Some wear on the carpet. Bed fine for 1 person but would be too small for 2 people. In-room safe. Min-far with FREE bottled water. Walls thinnish - could hear conversations, shower in the room next door; also some street noise. Smallish bathroom with very small shower stall. Clean bathroom. Effective air conditioner (needed in the hot, humid summer heat). Friendly helpful staff. Free continental breakfast. Complimentary bath slippers. Very good location -- easy walking distance to Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, other sites.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ian186338
Reviews.Content: The friendly welcome we received as soon as we arrived set the tone for the whole holiday. This is a small but well run hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. The room was air conditioned - a must in Rome in August!! The daily room service was also very good. There was a warm welcom to breakfast every day. The staff at reception could not have been more helpful. The hotel is very central and is in easy walking distance of all that Rome has to offer. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone. One slight warning however, there is a 2 euro per person per night tax charge that you must pay before you leave. This wasn't included in our tour pacakge and we had to pay 50 euros before we left. I guess this is the same for all Rome hotels and not the fault of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: mstrpoker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights on what was a trip of a lifetime (this years anyway) LOL. Hotel Regno room 452 was absolutely fantastic. Close to major tourist areas like the Pantheon, Coliseum and Trevi Fountain we found this hotel perfect for the money. Let's face it, Rome isn't cheap, but we were happy to spend the money here. The restaurants in the area were great as well. Follow your noise for the best smells. Will definitely return to Hotel Regno in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: kolbach
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here 6th July - 10thJuly , what a fantastic hotel ! We had a room on the 4th floor which was clean and tidy, the bathroom although small was fine. The Breakfast was plentyful with great coffee !. The beautiful Trevi Fountain was about a 2 mins walk from the hotel, and the Patheon just behind the Regno. It was also about a 10mins walk to the Flavian Amphitheatre . Would we stay here again - you bet !!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClancyMontana
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Regno was heaven! We had just had a horrible experience at another hotel not too far away from Regno and they had 2 nights available for us. They had been informed previously that we had been robbed at the subway (Rome) and were so very kind to us. They reassured us there was a safe in our room, to please go up to the eating area and relax and have a cappaccino and some food while they made up a room for us. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a darling terrace with a table, chairs, lounge chairs and beautiful plants...and an overhead retractable covering in case of rain. The room was very clean, air conditioned, soothing colors, updated furniture, WiFi, and the breakfast was great. Many choices and awesome coffees! They could not have done more to accommodate us and help us past our bad experiences we had had in Rome prior to our arrival at the Regno. Very close to the Pantheon, lots of great shops/ restaurants and the Trevi Fountain. They called a cab for us on the day we departed for Fuimicino (50 euros) and the cab was very prompt and took about 30 minutes to get there. GREAT hotel.... a little $$, but very worth it to feel safe, welcome and taken care of. Montana

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - again”
Reviews.Author: dulcieb
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad room. We had been to Regno before a few years ago though. We weren't disappointed. We had a level 5 quad room, with a lovely very large balcony. The room was large - definitely big enough for the 4 of us, with a nice bathtub. Breakfast was excellent - continental with cappucino, meat, cheese, croissants, bread, yoghurt, cereal. Very nice. Service is also excellent, recommendations from the hotel about where to eat and how to get places are reliable. Internet didn't work from the room, but we just sat in the public area on the 1st floor, which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: jandsetc
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from hotel reception. We arrived at reception to be told,that unbeknown to us, our booking company had ceased trading last month. The hotel had kept rooms for us despite not knowing whether we would arrive or not. This difficult situation was dealt with sympathetically and in excellent English by the reception staff. It would be difficult to find a hotel in a more convenient location to visit the sites. Our rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet if rather compact.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Family_on_the_go1962
Reviews.Content: A really well located hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The room we had faced the via del Corso but the triple glazing made it very quiet. We were impressed with how clean it was. Furnishings were new and it was well maintained. We would stay here again. We felt it was value for money for the location as it was right next to the pedestrian walkway through to the Pantheon and the Piazza Novona and a very short walk to the Trevi Fountain. There was a myriad of restaurants to choose from. I would stay here again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ordinary hotel for family of four”
Reviews.Author: Kingstonbeach
Reviews.Content: The hotel Regno is in a fantastic location, very close to the Trevi and the Parthenon but does not cater for families of four. Our quad room was so jammed we could hardly open the door to the bathroom. I'm guessing however that's the way it goes in ancient cities like Rome - if you want an apartment you probably have to head out to the burb where you lose the excellent location. Pretty average breakfast as well. Would not like to have the room that opens directly into the breakfast room either. Hotel has a bar but no barman so it's not open, shame. For over $450US per night I would have expected better. The free wifi only worked on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: ofiraf
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 1.2 year old boy at the hotel and we had a very nice stay Room is not large but very clean and quiet, service was excellent -staff are very friendly and helpful. there is free internet if you have the laptop with you Breakfast is ok - simple. Maybe the price is high for 3* hotel but I guess that’s Rome in general And most important Location is GREAT walking distance from everything. hope to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Rrodent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June 2011. The hotel is in a fantastic location, right in the middle of Rome! The hotel was very clean and our room was one of the spacious we had encountered on a trip - there were 3 of us so it was a triple room. The Sofa Bed was very initially very uncomfortable however once the hotel staff were informed they supplied extra blankets to put under the bed which made a significant difference. Considering that a new mattress could not be plucked from the air, they solved the problem the best they could. The breakfast was okay - would have preferred a bigger choice of cereal other then cornflakes, cornflakes and cornflakes and also some of the fruit supplied once opened up could not be eaten. They were only minor negatives about the Hotel. The hotel staff were great except for the one young gentlemen who had the personality of a brick and was just has as helpful however the rest of the staff were more then happy to answer questions. Overall I would recommend this hotel as it was very clean and also due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eileen B
Reviews.Content: The location has made it so much easier to get out and experience the sights of Rome. Simple breakfast, comfortable bed, easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Teampower
Reviews.Content: Location location location!! Situated in the heart of the city this hotel isn't overly big or fancy but is walking distance to all the main attractions and the staff were friendly. It also offers free wifi which no other hotels we've stayed at have. Room was clean and tidy. Perfect stay for those that want value for money and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: benohen
Reviews.Content: Shower flooded, the commode bathroom floor (across from the sink and shower) was soaking wet in the morning and on the last day, the toilet wouldn't flush... major plumbing problems. The continental breakfast was sparse, there was no restaurant in the hotel and you couldn't get coffee at the hotel anytime except during breakfast hours. There as no lobby and the staff was friendly but not very helpful. The location was amazing and we walked to every major attraction except the Vatican. If I were to go to Rome again, I would look for another hotel with a similar location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & breakfast -we'd say there again”
Reviews.Author: margaretm808
Reviews.Content: Felt very comfortable there although wish staff could speak English. Difficult to communicate with housekeeping, etc. ie asked for pillows...got shampoo, tv's didn't work Men at the Front desk staff bit stiff but women were friendlier and again even though there were 2-3 behind desk....only one could speak well. Great about booking tours for us. Fantastic restaurant in alley on right side. Access to wireless email easy but difficult to figure out how to. When you look up networks, you cannot directly access Hotel Regno but have to go through another network first. When suggested that they highlight that when they issue access codes, got the "look". Lobby quite crowded and they also keep the stored luggage out front so no place to sit. Little stuff...great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DH14
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Hotel Regno. The location is wonderful - a short stroll to the Trevi Fountain in one direction and the Pantheon in another. You can also walk to the Forum nearby. Plus there are bus stops right outside the hotel and you can easily reach the Vatican, Colosseum, Trestevere and many more locations. We had a large family room on the first floor which had space for 4 people. It was spacious. Breakfast was fine. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. They also arranged airport pick ups and drop offs (55 euros in cash). The only negative point was the room was a bit dark and the bathroom needed better ventilation. But overall a pleasant stay. Also the hotel roof terrace is no more. The access area has been turned into another room.

Reviews.Title: “Location unbelievable!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beckchur
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Regno for 3 nights in April and again overnight in early May. We were so pleased with the central location. We were literally a few minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain in one direction and the Pantheon in the other. It was also easy walking distance to the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona. The staff were helpful and pleasant, the room spacious, comfortable and clean and the breakfasts tasty. I would definitely stay here again if I were to visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service, a useful city centre stop-over.”
Reviews.Author: gravyfancier
Reviews.Content: Statyed here week before Easter with my wife and daughter. There's no doubting the convenience of the location of Hotel Regno - it's right on Via del Corso, with all of central Rome's attractions easily walkable. Great for returning late afternoon after a day's sight-seeing to refresh before heading out for dinner. Reception staff friendly, welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was fine - typical of Rome tourist hotel, with a good selection of cold meats, cereals etc. Our room, although small, was comfortable, consistently clean and although a little tired and would benefit from some updating, was well laid out, with a separate room for our daughter. All in all, it's an excellent budget option and I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Rome - look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Bringley
Reviews.Content: This will be short and sweet. Stay at the Hotel Regno. Great location, great location and great location. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. Smiles all around every time we arrived at the lobby. Walking distance to EVERYTHING. Clean rooms. Comfy bed. Great shower (although tiny bathroom... be warned).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: andyvandin
Reviews.Content: We loved Rome and had a great place to base ourselves at Hotel Regno. Great location, good comfortable room, attentive service and overall a really nice experience. I would recommend this if you are looking for a reasonably priced great located hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Location, Friendly & Informative Staff”
Reviews.Author: kalyngra
Reviews.Content: Had 2 stays at this hotel with a tour of the Amalfi Coast in between stays. The hotel looked after a lot of our luggage whilst we were away for a week. The second stay we had a "lesser" room. I thought it was the best room in the hotel, it was on the first floor on the corner of the building, with a balcony on Via del Corso and the corner of Via de Pietra. Very noisy but atmosphere galore. To cut out the noise it had double shutters so sleeping was not a problem. Watching the passing parade off the balcony was extraordinary. Many great little al fresco restaurants close by. Markets across the road. In the Via de Pietra we discovered a great little restaurant La Rotunda El Tempo, I believe. Excellent Italian food including wine for under 30 euros for a couple of courses. The hotel staff were excellent with getting baggage to our room, Nice little breakfast restaurant, and concierge staff were extremely helpful with arranging Transport to Fiumicino Airport and were willing to provide a great insight into Rome and how the people think.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: teachertravel_11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in Central Rome. Turn right out of the front door and walk a few blocks to Vittorio Emanuele II at Piazza Venezia and once there look to your left and you will see the Colloseum in the close distance. To the right of the amazing building in front of you, up and around is the Capitoline Museum..highly recommend..be sure to find the underground view of the forum..spectacular and if you can find the elevator to the restaurant, the terrace offers a fantastic skyline view of Rome. Directly across from the Regno the pedestrian walkway with vendors is a short walk to the Trevi. To your right and across the street is a tourist info booth. You can purchase bus tickets there or at any newspaper stand. They can provide bus info and bus stops are on both sides. Turn left out of the Regno to the first pedestrian walk through on your left and if you follow the signs you will come to a the spectacular panthenon and the Tazza d'Oro coffee shop and piazzas full of candlelit, tented restaurants. The Vatican is a longer walk but you can google a walking map to see interesting sites along the way including the Spanish steps. We were told that long lineups are early in the day as the cruise ship tours and other group tours are in the morning. The Regno offered free morning continental breakfasts with great coffee and internet is 5E for an hour. Wifi is free but you have to get their code each day and sit by the front desk. We were expecting a very small room but we had plenty of room and a lovely marble and spacious bathroom, maybe because we had emailed ahead for two double beds. If you book the Eurorail several days in advance you can get a great deal and the station is easy to get around. We went to Florence for day to see the statue of David and there is beautiful architecture, bridges and leather coats and shoes, scarfs and other things are readily available at all the street lined vendor booths. For us four hours would have been sufficient in Florence and we found from 9 in the morning until 9 at night long. We would highly recommend the cooking class Andrea Consoli, Executive Chef, Cooking Classes in Rome, www.cookingclassesinrome.com. It was a great end to our trip and as much as the March rain was not a deterrent for us, it was a rainy day. Andrea was funny and interesting and his dishes were emailed to us after as they were practical, delicious and easy to make. Before sitting down to eat we were offered to do wine pairing for 20E as well, which I would also recommend. He has a great menu for dining as well and he recommends the many establishments in Trastevere area for experiencing true italian dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely room, charming service”
Reviews.Author: DianeFromSurrey
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was expected as we were greeted by name as we came into Reception. Excellent sign of a good hotel. Maps, info etc given straight away. Situated on one of the main streets and just footsteps away from the pedestrianised side streets. Turn one way for Trevi and the other for Pantheon and Piazza Navona. We had a street-facing room, number 330. Bus stop 20 metres for 1 euro trip to St Peters. Absolutely quiet with double-double glazing and shutters. Room was elegant, spacious enough, spotlessly clean. Bathroom had tub, shower-over, hair-dryer, lit mirror. Room was well lit and had air con/heating. Breakfast in airy, bright 'conservatory' was quickly served. Usual choice of bread and bakery items, fruit, yogurts, cheese, cold meats etc. (Twinings English Breakfast Tea readily available!) Our booking had quoted 'Hot Buffet' but we only saw hot drinks and a toaster machine. Found the hotel in Cresta's City brochure. We checked the rates direct with hotel before we checked with Trip Advisor's suggested 'agents' Compared all the rates. Rate was 30% cheaper with Otels.com and much cheaper than booking a package. Thought there may have been some mistake, but not! Having discovered the Regno, I wouldn't bother with anywhere else in future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SazMc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights.Good value for money.Did report flicking light and didn't get fixed also when people above used the loo or had a shower sounded like it was coming straight into the room.Saying this it was what it was,room clean and comfortable,but reception staff and breakfast room staff appear a bit pressured at times but nice enough.The location was very good and would recommend to others,but take it as it is. Wasn't able to use the internet though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all the sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Donnit
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel, had a standard double, a comfortable room on the front corner of the hotel with small balcony. Some traffic noise even with the extra shutters, but too tired at night to care!!! About 15 minutes to Colosseum and about 20-25 to Vatican City. Good places to eat near Pantheon, and some good pizza slice places around Trevi Fountain. If you arrive at Termini station ask price for taxi to hotel, first one said 29 euros!!!!!! no way, went to another taxi rank and the price was 7.90 to get to hotel. Cheapest is to take the 175 bus to Corso for 1 euro each, thanks to hotel reception for that tip on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “Rome on your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: therogz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Regno, had awesome time. The location is fantastic, 5 minutes to the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain great restaurants and bars just minutes walk away. Our room was small but very clean and comfortable and well soundproofed from the 24 hour Rome traffic noise. Breakfast was very good but chaotic due to the fact that everyone arrived around 9 a.m. so despite their efforts, the staff had a constant battle to clear tables and seat waiting Guests.A couple of things we were slightly dissapointed with were, what appears to be the Roof Terrace shown in the Hotels Website is in fact a bookable a Room and the Hotel Bar was never open during our stay, plus there is no booze in the mini Bar, so if you want a pre dinner snifter you have to go out to find a Bar.All in all the Staff were very friendly and attentive. Just a note about getting to the Regno from the Airport. Watch out for Taxi Drivers who will Rip You Off, we walked it took 30 minutes but all down hill and it was fun.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK NO FURTHER”
Reviews.Author: Paddy130749
Reviews.Content: We are just back after a long (rugby) weekend. The location of this hotel is superb. We were able to walk everywhere. One minute to the Trevi Fountain - a great bonus when your wife has no sense if direction and keeps getting lost! The staff were very friendly and helpful. They spoke excellent English. Breakfast was good and served with a smile. Plenty of choice and all very fresh. We had four rooms and all were really good. They all seemed to have been re-furbished recently. Great value for money - look out for their special deals eg four nights for the price of three. Very few negatives. There is a bar, but for some reason it never opens. Do not listen to the person who recommended the pizzeria two doors away (must have been the owner!). We did and it was simply awful - possibly the worst meal I have ever had anywhere. There are loads of very good restaurants nearby. We ate in Piazza San Ignacio, just around the corner and it was great. Two tips. 1. Check out the Habana bar nearby. Turn left out of the Regno, left again and go about 300 yards. It's on the left hand side. Looks downmarket, but very friendly, very reasonable and they have live music every night for no charge. 2. Always check your bill. We found several 'mistakes' in the short time we were there. I hesitate to post this review in case the Regno is booked out the next time we want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bardo71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value option in Rome, its not luxorious but in a very good location. Ideal for a long weekend stay to visit Rome's main attractions. The minus is the staff, who while attentive, they are not very knowledgeable about Rome (ie they said the Colisseum last entry was at 6pm, which is wrong, and they said the Borghese museum was closed on Sundays, which is wrong, and failed to mention a prebooking is needed)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AlyOT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first leg of our honeyemoon. It was a great little spot with a wonderful breakfast and easy access to all of the sights. The best pizza of our trip was at a little cafe two doors away.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Location”
Reviews.Author: EalingBlue
Reviews.Content: The location is really unbeatable - in a few minutes you can be at Trevi, The Pantheon, or to the Campidoglio. And if shopping is your thing, head North up The Via Del Corso for the cities most fashionable shopping district. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, from the front desk to the chambermaids - really a huge asset to this hotel. Our twin room was clean and tidy, and obviously refurbished fairly recently. Minor grumbles? Room was very 'compact' , and there was a certain amount of noise from the restaurants in the Via de Pietra below. But you expect this in a major city centre. The biggest problem for me was the size of the single beds - I'm no Peter Crouch, but my feet still stuck out of the end of the bed, and the mattress was also pretty firm. All in all, I was very pleased with the hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Boogyboots
Reviews.Content: Read some reviews before we went and some complained of decor and service, but we found the place fantastic. It is right in the middle of the old part of Rome surrounded by ancient buildings, the major sites and the labarinth of lanes that are Rome. On one of the major shopping streets, there is a bar 2 doors away if the fact the hotel bar is never open proves a problem for you. There are dozens of good value restaurants within a few minutes walk. The Trevi fountain is 3 mins walk one way, and the Pantheon 3 mins walk the other. The vatican only took us 30 mins to walk. The hotel provides a great buffet breakfast to set you up for the day and the staff really took care of us. The room had a safe and a mini bar, with reasonably priced drinks. I will go back to Rome, and I will look to stay in the Regno.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Central Location to all sights”
Reviews.Author: Juros
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at Hotel Regno, Room was clean and tidy. We had a small balcony which was great to get fresh air into the room. Rooms are small, like everywhere in Rome, It was perfect for us.So close to all attractions, the trevi fountain only 200 metres away pantheon just behind hotel a 300 metres away. Roman forum, Collesum, all in easy walking distance. Close to hop on hop off buses. Would highly recommended staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Central everything - transport, restaurants, shopping, historics sights & monuments.”
Reviews.Author: Adelaideans
Reviews.Content: The reception area may be small and pokie but don't let this bother you. Our rooms were very comfortable and roomy. The bathroom was clean and of reasonable size. The breakfast room was very adequate and the food and service was good. Don't be too hung up on the rooms. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. Everything is so close to make you Rome experience all the more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place from which to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: BirdieVisitor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno could not be situated in a better location, within easy walking of all tourist attractions. We used the bus stop just down the road to catch a bus to the Vatican as our booked tour started at 10am, but we could have walked it. During our stay we had to move rooms twice, first due to plumbing problems and secondly due to a defective rail in the wardrobe, causing our clothes to crash onto the floor ( funny in retrospect, although not at the time). All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is less than able bodied. Our rooms were on the fifth and sixth floors and most of the time we walked up and down the stairs. The lift only holds 4 people. It kept us fit. The breakfast was good, plentiful and varied. One small thing that would be an improvement would be the reopening of the bar. It exists but is permanently closed. With the absence of drink making facilities in the rooms (is this just an english thing?) the ability to obtain hot drinks and alcohol would greatly improve the hotel and increase profits surely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dolce1976
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and very central to main attractions, the Trevi Fountain is literally a 2 minute walk from the hotel.... The hotel staff very extremely freindly, especially Rosa from the front desk who made our time at Hotel regno enjoyable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The satff will go out of there way to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Well Worth Considering”
Reviews.Author: Joe_50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno was our second choice because our first option at a 4* hotel was not available. We were not disappointed, however. Its location is fantastic - literally round the corner from backstreets with lots of independent restaurants, within easy walking distance of many of the major sites, and on a bus route to others such as the Vatican. Our room was surprisingly large for a city centre hotel, and although the bathroom was a bit tired, we were perfectly happy with the quality of the accommodation. The hotel fronts on to the Via del Corso, but the windows effectively kept out the city's noise and we slept well for the three nights we were there. Breakfast was pretty good - a typical continental assortment of cold cuts, cheeses and pastries. Avoid the sweetened orange juice, though! Although we tend to look for 4*hotels and this is rightly classified as 3*, we would certainly consider staying there again, if only for its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round city hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EssexGardener
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an excellent holiday with another couple. We recommend this hotel because of its excellent location. We walked to all the main tourist attractions, and my three travelling companions are all old enough to own free bus passes!! Contrary to some previous reviewers, we found the breakfast good, both fresh and plentiful. We found the reception desk staff very helpful, especially Gabriele. Our only disappointment was that the bar never opened. We were told that it was too close to some of the rooms, and caused too much disturbance to the occupants. Although our rooms had a mini-bar, there were no glasses provided. One evening we would have loved a coffee, but were told that "the bar was closed". In our opinion still a good choice for a medium priced hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, clean, central & great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Jac
Reviews.Content: Very efficient check-in, room clean & warm, TV remote didnt work but staff at desk assisted. Loved the plentiful continental breakfast. Very close to all the attractions. MacDonalds is just down the Lane opposite. 2 Minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain !

Reviews.Title: “we loved this place”
Reviews.Author: richard_powell1
Reviews.Content: i have to say I was really worried about staying in this hotel after some of the reviews thst have been posted, but I shouldn't have been, bacause we had a great time and i would very happily stay here again, the staff were excellent and really friendly and helpful, our room was really nice. The locaton of the hotel was of course was superb. yes the lift is small but as we alway use the stairs, it did not really bother us. The breakfast was good, and the coffee excellent. Both was and my husband agree that when we visit rome again this is the place for us.

Reviews.Title: “great location !”
Reviews.Author: lilykfoury
Reviews.Content: the first impression of this hotel was rly bad :small lobby ,weird smell,narrow elevator...but then we noticed that this hotel had many positive points : it had a great location walking distance to all the important monuments and has a bus station nearbuy if u want to visit the monument of castel st angel or the vatican ..the staff is rly nice , they showed us on the map the easiest ways to get to the monuments finally the breakfast was fair nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff was rude and not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mitchell810
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was rude and not very helpful...Toilet seat in the bathroom was broken...The floors in the room had not been clean in quite some time...Housekeeping did not knock, and walked in on me while I was changing, even though I had the deadbolt locked...

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sullivan72
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Italy, I must say this hotel is not what it seems. First of all it is old, when you flush the toilet water drips from the ceiling. Carpets are nasty. Phone did not work in room to make outside call. The bathroom has a toilet and bidet in one and the sink and shower in another. Breakfast was ok. The only good thing about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Our days in Rome were hot but not...”
Reviews.Author: CugTravel
Reviews.Content: Our days in Rome were hot but not oppressive but if we were in need of cool solice on any of the days it would not be found in the Regno. From the moment we arrived we found the entry and common hallways stifling. This was particularly difficult since the crampt elevator was always busy. Moreover the air conditioning in our room limped along at best. If you sat still you were fine but if you moved around forget it. The staff at the front desk during daylight hours was not friendly at all. They never offered any assistance and when they did it was clear it was a bother to them. The short little fellow and his sidekick were very prickly and it became a game with my kids to see how prickly they would be upon entering the hotel. The only redeeming quality was the location. The Regno is located centrally near all of the historical sites and close to a Metro station. We found this extremely beneficial. The rooms were clean but the common areas were filthy. Broken tiles, dirt crammed into corners, peeling wallpaper and a hallway bathroom that put up a horrific stink. The Regno is well located but there are others. It in no way lived up to the advertised 2 star ranking. Stay at your own risk,

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: pje39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regno for 4 nights - the rooms (double) are quite small but we werent visiting rome to stay in the Hotel room! The breakfast is good and we found the service to be friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic! Steps from the Trevi, Pantheon and Piazza Navona - easy walking distance to the colloseum. The Location has to be one of the best in Rome for the main tourist sights. If i visited Rome again i would try to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal spot to explore rome”
Reviews.Author: ManWithSillyHat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regno is situated away from most of the normal tourist hotels - which is good. its a short cab ride from the main terminus and is centrally located for most of rome's historic sites. walkable to the colluseum, trevi, vatican etc. Staff friendly and rooms a good size. our room was set round the back - and was fantastically quiet, not a car horn heard all week! - good for a great sleep after a long day exploring. The bathroom was clean and modern if a little small. the shower required you to be quite agile to negotiate the way in - id be wary if you had any disability or werent as fit as you once were(!) only gripe was coffee service at breakfast could sometime be erratic, especially when the weekend staff are on!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: jannibaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June with my husband and 2 20-something children. This was the only hotel during our 2 week trip that we were getting a quad. Our travel agent was concerned we would be cramped but when we got there, those fears went out the window. We were in room 568, which is a converted apt. on the top floor. Our room was huge with 2 twin beds and one queen that was a murphy bed type. There was a sink, table with chairs, huge balcony. Looking out our balcony we could see the Victor Emmanuel monument and at the other end was Piazza del Popolo. We were steps away from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. The staff were super helpful. We also appreciated the free wi-fi room. I have seen some of the reviews stating the rooms were small. I can definitely say this was not the case in the quad we stayed in. Do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blackbird101
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not be better. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We LOVED the continental breakfast, the selection was very generous and yummy, and it was here that I had the best cappuccino in Rome! For a real treat be sure and try the hot chocolate! There is a very comfortable room to use for WiFi free of charge. If you don't want to bring your laptop with you, they have a computer and you can log on for 5 euros per hour, or 3 euros for 30 minutes. The hotel itself is very cute and charming. There are so many great restaurants close by. We really enjoyed our stay and will return again to this hotel when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “dodgy electrics, and a ceiling that drips ...”
Reviews.Author: nmkd
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - easy walking to many attractions, the bus to railway station leaves from directly across the road, and the staff were friendly. However, the light above the bed kept flickering after it was turned off, the ceiling dripped water onto the end of the bed, and the only window was a door that opened onto a balcony shared by many other rooms - so leaving the window open for 'fresh' air didn't feel like a very safe option. The ceiling drip stopped when the rain stopped, the light was fixed the next day but then the hairdryer no longer worked!

Reviews.Title: “Regno is a find when you need one!”
Reviews.Author: omralk
Reviews.Content: As we know, finding a room for four in Europe is not easy. We just decided we would have to compromise if we wanted to go to Rome as a tag-along on a family trip. Thanks to Trip Advisor, we learned that if we stayed at the Hotel Regno, we could have a chance of having a comfortable, convenient, and not unaffordable trip to Roma. The actual experience proved our hopes as well. Regno's service was accomodating and available. They were able to point us in the right direction and made thoughtful and rewarding recommendations on restaurants, transport, and attractions. (I am especially grateful they pointed us to the Roma Pass, which made the city affordable, helped us escape all lines, and got us on public transport.) The rooms, converted from apartments and still decorated with sleek mahogany wood and a delightful pied a terre, were large enough that we didn't feel like sardines, The bathroom was large enough too. The location is right on Via del Corso, on a major tourist artery, but we were able to turn this to our advantage.
