We walked to the Trevi fountain ( a favorite of the kids', so we kept returning), as well as Piazza Navona, the National Museum, the Coliseum, Forum, the Jewish Quarter, etc. We took the Metro to the Vatican and had to take a cab to Trastavere. They booked us the cab and we didn't get fleeced on the price. The only eh-eh at Regno is the breakfast. Sufficient, but not on par with the class of the hotel. The room is a big worn, the food selection limited and bland, and it took a while to get coffee -- if at all. But we were adequately pumped to start the day, and indulge in culinary treasures almost anywhere else in the city. For the day we needed to get online, we were able to purchase it at Regno; printing was an additional charge, unfortunately, but that's not out of line. We recommend Regno for any family, and probably a couple or individual too. If only every city had such quads....

Reviews.Title: “Near all atractions! I'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: BrazilRenata
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Regno Hotel is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Staff is great and helpful. The room was somewhat small, but had a little balcony that ended up adding . Breakfast could be better. Anyway, I recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful and very central”
Reviews.Author: gill145
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Close to Trevi fountain and 10 minute walk to Vatican or Coliseum

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KitKolar
Reviews.Content: Three generations of women stayed in a quad deluxe room with balcony for 4 nights, (double bed and 2 singles). We were able to walk everywhere in Rome, and my 75 yr. old mother with 2 artificial hips and a heart stent was able to enjoy the heart of Rome without having to rely on cabs. Hotel Regno is situated between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Originally we wanted a full service hotel but we are so glad we picked this hotel for the perfect location. Breakfast was adequate to start the day. Rooms and bathrooms are small but clean ; quad deluxe had stained glass sliding dividers to separate rooms and a balcony to people watch and check the weather. Via Del Corso is a busy street and a bit noisy at times but you are in a city. Internet is available for a fee. Hotel staff were pleasant . I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not far from the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Virginia15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Regno at the end of my holiday to Turkey, Greece and Italy. This was my second visit to Roma, and loved it because you are close to all the fabulous attractions Rome has to offer. Best of all it is very close to the Pantheon, one of my most favourite monuments. The service was very good. One of my favourite personal sayings is "certainly" and the lovely receptionist who checked me was delighted with the expression, and adopted it as part of her customer service. The room was very comfortable, but I did stay in a double room because I wanted some space for a few days before heading home after being on the road for a few weeks. There was plenty of food at breakfast and certainly enough to fill you up for a few hours. Overall a very good experience. Because it is near all the attractions I could go out in the morning for a few hours, have lunch, come back and have a rest, then go out again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city break base”
Reviews.Author: Bob&Alison
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on a main arterial road through the city centre and so noise can be expected for about 20 hrs a day. Our room was situated overlooking the main street & on the 1st floor. There is a small lift. We had very disturbed sleep for 3 nights but we coped. The hotel is not near metro stations. Hotel location was very useful for catching the 175 bus every 15 mins to or from Termini Station as the stop is almost outside the hotel (€1 p/person) buy ticket before you travel from information centre opposite hotel or newsagents. Validate ticket on the bus. We were pleased with the hotel as we find in general European hotel standards lower than British but this hotel disserved its full star rating. It did not have a restaurant (except for breakfast) or bar open when we were there but it is possible there may be one in higher season. Breakfast was continental, don't expect full English. There was one bedroom directly off the breakfast room which we were glad we were not in. (1st floor). It was in an excellent location to walk to the main sites of interest. Be careful of the café just down the street (south) where we bought HALF a sandwich (by accident) for €2 (rip off) however we did have a reasonable warm lunch there. We would stay here again but may pack earplugs or request a room not overlooking the main street although it was nice to see the street from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Super duper hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamreez
Reviews.Content: _ excellent spacious rooms and spacious bathrooms _ no noise from the street even though our room was on via del corso side _ we had two extra beds for children _amazing breakfast and friendly staff at the resturant (haven't seen breakfast like the one in Regno in average European hotels) _helpful staff at the reception _all the good locations and main tourist attractions near by walking distance Over all, My wife and two children (3 and 5 yrs old) thoroughly enjoyed the stay at the hotel. Don't get disappointed by the small reception, lobby and the lift. Look forward to the comfort. You will enjoy your stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travel_bugs_1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August with 2 toddlers (aged 1.5 & 2.5yrs) This hotel is in a great location, the staff were very helpful and we were offered a great rate. We had a rear room so not a great view but it was very quite and we heard no street noise, the bath has a funny step in it which made it a little tricky to bath the kids but the room was comfortable enough to accommodate us all. Breakfast was enough although seating is limited. Being a travel agent I was a little nervous booking somewhere different but I will only stay at Regno from now on. Location is fantastic, we walked everywhere so great for the little ones in the pram.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMM1907
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. 2 mins walk to Pantheon, 5 min to Trevi Fountain, 10 min walk to Roman Forum and 15 min walk to Collaseum. Very clean. Newly renovated rooms are big and clean but not all rooms have been upgraded yet. Room 224 was very nice and a good size for 2 adults and 2 children under 11. Lots of restaurants are nearby and its in a lovely shopping area too. Bad point is that it takes about 40 min by taxi from the airport. There is a small breakfast area but no dining room but this does not matter as the area has many places to eat. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break and it seems to be on quite a lot of discounted internet sites so great value. Mini bar was very cheap price wise so again good value unlike most things in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Frostie716
Reviews.Content: The Regno is the perfect hotel for sightseeing in Rome. The tourist office is directly across the street, just steps from the bus stop and the nearby sopping and dining is exeptional. The breakfast room and restaurant is elegsnt. The staff was very helpful with storing bags, advice for transportation and making our stay enjoyable. This was our second visit to this hotel and I will be back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kayt83
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Regno and we were again very happy with it. The position is fantastic and it is difficult to find a comparably priced hotel in such a good location. The staff were wonderful and our room was unusually large by European standards, with a separate sitting area and a balcony. The rooms are very clean and a good breakfast is provided. The only drawback is that the hotel can at times be a little noisy given its location, however this never troubled us at all and we will definitely consider staying here again when next visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Nicky092
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Regno for six nights, from 12th October 2009. We found the location ideal for getting to various sights. We had a room on the sixth floor, with a lovely terrace, large enough to sit out and enjoy, with flowering plants. The double-bed was placed against the wall, which was a bit inconvenient, but the bathroom was very up-to-date and there was always hot water. Unfortunately the sounds from the neighbouring bathroom were very evident, when running baths or showers. The Reception & Breakfast Room Staff were always so friendly and helpful and we always got a smile. The small entrance hides a great little Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 night post cruise stay at the Regno. We hav estayed in Rome before a number of times at better and more expensive hotels. However with the cost of the cruise we were a little more cost concious this time in selecting the hotel. The hotel has a brilliant location within easy walking distance to all the main tourist sights. We had a great room at the top overlooking the Via Del Corso. There were no noise problems as the heavy curtains and double glazing blocked out any street noise. Our friends room was at the back and had two single beds which didnt impress and as the hotel was full they couldnt changed, so had to push them together. Breakfast as previously stated on this thread was nothing to write home about and the coffee was almost undrinkable but it was enough to get us going. The staff were helpful and very pleasant and arranged an airport transfer for us, as well as giving recommendations for somewhere to eat. If you have big money to spend then stay somewhere better, but for what we paid we were more than satisfied

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kconnoll
Reviews.Content: This is a our second stay at the Hotel Regno. First stayed in June 2007 and was so happy with our stay then we decided to stay again this year. The hotel is so centrally located and within easy walking distance of all the major attractions. We had two stays at the hotel this year 3 days prior to a cruise and two days after. Our room on the first stay was great except for the bathrom every time we had a shower we nearlly flooded the bathroom. Didn't matter what we tried we could not adjust shower nozzle to stop it spraying onto the floor. Also the airconditoining unit was very noisy and old. On our return stay our room was so tiny we could hardly move. To be honest it was really only suitable for one person. Also once again the shower nozzle faced the wrong way and we flooded the bathroom floor each time we showered. Also the lock on the bathroom door was broken. The air conditioning unit inthis room was also nosiy and on the last day it broke down. The carpet in hthe hallways was in need of a good clean. My husband was unable to drink the coffee at breakfast . On a positive note the staff were always friendly and helpful. Would only stay at the hotel again if we were guarantee us a larger room than our last stay and that the air conditioning unit and showers hd been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Desi78
Reviews.Content: We spent four memorable nights in Rome, and loved our stay at Hotel Regno. It is clean, neat and spacious with lovely friendly staff. The location is central to all the must see landmarks, restaurants and shops. We had a lovely spacious terrace over looking Via Del Corso - not that we spent much time out there. Hotel Regno was recommended to us and I would have no hesitation in recommending this lovely spot to anyone looking for a central affordable hotel in Rome. Breakfast was nothing to write home about. My husband and l love our Italian coffee and realised after our first breakfast, in order to get a 'real' cafe latte we had to specify we wanted 'espresso e caffe latte' as they were bringing us a pot of frothed milk with disgusting instant coffee. They must have thought we dont know real coffee. Other than this little hiccup l would recommend Hotel Regno as a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, great location - will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Maz969
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Regno from 5-9 June 2009. All I can say is it is in an absolutely fabulous location, numerous shops, restaurants and all the best attractions are within walking distance. Rooms are of a good size for Rome, to our shock they had given us a double bed but that wasnt a problem as the bed was very large! Bathroom was clean and tidy, mirrors everywhere. Our room looked over the villa de corso main street, however the double glazing was excellent and drowned about 95% of the street noise. I would recommend the Piccolo Bucco restaurant which is a small family run place just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain, try to avoid the restaurants that prey on you as you walk past, the food is good but they do pressure you and were too mainstream for our liking. We took an open top bus tour but found this was not necessary due to the close proximity of all the best sites. You must see the Vatican and Piazza Navona is great for people watching and a cappacino. Take your credit card - across the road from the Spanish Steps, Gucci, Prada, Versaci and all the top names. The trip was expensive but well worth it, I will definitely be going back for round 2 next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Perfect Location, clean with good staff”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from the 25th through the 28th of May. If was a great location with easy walking access to all major attractions. We only took a cab to train station to leave. Rooms were clean although it does need new carpet etc but clean for Italy. Bathrooms were fine although the hot/cold pulsed a lot. Great breakfast and very helpful staff. It was pricey, but I think if you want to stay in the heart of Ancient Rome you're going to pay those rates anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: MikeLondonUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with two friends at the Hotel Regno for six nights. My friend booked the stay in Rome through Kirker Holidays and, after the booking was made, I did have some reservations after reading some comments on Trip Advisor - some were very good and other very poor. However Kirker are normally very good so I did look on the positive side. The location of the hotel is excellent, there are dozens of good restaurants nearby and it was nice to join the crowds at either the Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon before turning in for the night. We found the hotel reception staff upon arrival (Rosa and Gabrielle) both friendly and helpful. We had booked a room with a bath but the room offered only had a shower. Fortunately the hotel were able to offer us the choice of two further rooms, both with baths. The rooms were a good size with ample storage etc. Our room overlooked the Via del Corso which is a busy road but fortunately the windows were double glazed and eliminated most of the traffic noise (apart from police sirens). We were able to keep these closed at night since the room was air conditioned. Although the standard of decoration was a little tired the level of cleanliness was very good with clean towels daily and bed linen changed every other day. As in other Trip Advisor comments the breakfast situation could be much improved. The number of tables was inadequate for the number of guests so if you arrived later that 8.00am you would search for a table (especially for more than two). The coffee was dreadful and they only seemed to provide enough fresh fruit for the first few diners. After the first day we found a really good deli down the Via delle Muratte (opposite the hotel and near the Trevi Fountain) where we brought our own bananas and took them into breakfast. However I have no complaints about the cold buffet, the cereals or croissants. If you wanted something hot it did cost extra, my wife did have a runny boiled egg one morning for 1.70 euro!! Although there was a number for room service this was never answered. After visiting reception we did manage to get a pot of tea sent to the room after about 40 minutes. To summarise the hotel was in a great location, it was clean and we had no major complaints – the breakfast accommodation the only thing that really let them down.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location,”
Reviews.Author: navanman_9
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the sights of rome well this is your hotel and location. The hotel was spotless, good size rooms, fantastic breakfast, Trevi Fountain 2 mins, Pantheon 3 mins, spanish steps 6 mins,Vatican 30 mins. can't say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Everything Touristy”
Reviews.Author: AlbaLima
Reviews.Content: We were initially disheartened by our room which was very small for three people. (5 Night stay) . The bathroom was tiny. The staff are very friendly and helpful. But we made the most of our stay by getting out everyday and seeing the sights of Rome. On our way back to Australia we stayed there again for our last night in Italy and we were given a larger room which we loved. I would recommend this hotel for any one with a budget.

Reviews.Title: “If it's not one thing, it's another”
Reviews.Author: beneatharthursseat
Reviews.Content: I strongly dislike writing negative reviews, but after six nights in this hotel I felt I had no choice. After asking twice for a room for our honeymoon (on the phone and when we arrived), we were greeted by a room with two twin beds. The walls are paper thin and you can expect to be woken up very early every morning either by people walking in the hallways or by the loud construction in the dining area. After two nights, we were finally moved to another (double!) room. We were assured that they would move our luggage, but when we returned to the hotel after an hour we found the original room door propped open and the luggage still inside. At some point, credit cards that had been stored in the room safe disappeared, and when we asked for help we were met with unhelpful staff and blank stares. Charges later appeared in another country on one of these cards before we'd even returned home! The "free wireless" offered by the hotel simply didn't work, even right next to the router. Our second hotel room also smelled of sewage every time we opened it up after being gone for a few hours. Thank goodness for windows that open! If all you are looking for is a central location and plan to carry no valuables and sleep with earplugs in at night, then this might be the hotel for you. The positive: Great location, very central. Excellent breakfast, attentive breakfast staff. Furnishings seemed fairly new and in good shape. Nice view over Via del Corsa if you have a room at the front of the hotel. Many restaurants nearby, short walk to Trevi Fountain and Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mikvik
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 6 nites in the Hotel Regno Rome, as part of a 3 week trip around Italy with my partner and 2 children aged 9 and 13. The Hotel Regno was suggested by our agent but unfortunately, the Hotel was not quite what we expected. Some points to note were: + tiny rooms; + rooms in need of maintenance - ie lots of peeling paint + front desk staff with attitude (ie Question _ "We are catching a taxi to the station. Do we just pay the fare on the taxi meter or are there additional charges for baggage ..." Answer "I do not know. Ask the driver what he thinks..."; + the hotel has a good central location but no charm. I think we paid EURO 150 per night, for a double room. WHile I understand Rome is expensive, I feel we were paying a lot for very little. We got much better value in Milan (Hotel Lloyd) and Venice (Hotel Schiavello) We would have moved to another hotel with comparable rates (for example the Capo de Africa) but for the fact that we had already paid for our rooms at the Regno.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regno”
Reviews.Author: TimCHerts
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno is in an excellent location. Easy distance to the Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon, the Colosseum etc. We found the hotel to be clean, friendly and very functional. Good directions and advice given at reception. Our room was on the 3rd floor and had a great view over the Via Corsa, including a small balcony. Perhaps the rooms at the rear of the building maybe not so good. The room however, did have very thin walls. It has no lounge area as such but as Rome has so much to offer we didn't want to spend time in the hotel. Breakfast was adequate and if you are not too late in dining had lots of variety. We booked via BA, and our four night stay with breakfast was at the same rate as a travel inn in the UK.Marvelous value. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: JBav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for 3 nights at the end of our holiday. The people at check in were friendly and helpful. The position of the Hotel is perfect for both shopping and sightseeing. The Hotel itself is a bit of a rabbit warren with a lot of steps, but our room was quiet and the beds were extremely comfortable. The furnishings were new and elegant and the room was very comfortable. The breakfast room was busy as some others have mentioned, but we always found a table. Some rooms opened off the breakfast room and I should think they must have been noisy. All in all, it was much better than 2 stars and I would stay there again, especially for the position, right on the Via Corso.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SusieCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in October 2008 for 3 nights. Whilst the location is good , I'm sure you could find better accommodation for the price in the same area. The room - single - was adequate but the shower was a shower base with a curtain which meant the floor flooded each time it was used. The staff were disinterested to the point of being rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: pghlwr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Regno Sept. 16-20th, as last stop on honeymoon trip to Italy. As is often cited in the reviews on this hotel, the location is very, very good- you are in the middle of many of the tourist stops, including the Trevi, Pantheon, Forum, etc. Located on the Via Del Corso, which is one of the main shopping streets in Rome. The front desk was courteous and efficient, providing us with a very useful map of Rome. No language problems. Our room, which was located on the first floor (which to us in the U.S. would be considered the second floor), was spacious, and had air conditioning, though it wouldn't make the room "cold" as far as U.S. standards are concerned. However, it was the only hotel that we stayed at in Italy that had it at all. One of the reasons it had a.c. was that there was no terrace or balcony of any sort (though our travel agent had requested one for us months in advance)- when we asked to change rooms, we were told there were no terrace rooms available. Our window looked out onto an air shaft- definitely our worst view in Italy. We were also told, when we asked, that there was no sort of outdoor space available for our use at all- i.e. no communal terrace, garden area etc., which I was disappointed in, as their website lead me to believe there would be some sort of outdoor area to hang out in. Also, the breakfast room/bar was on the same floor as our room, and played very loud U.S. music starting at about 6:30 a.m., which could be clearly heard in our room- luckily we had a noise machine with us to drown out the sound. Otherwise, the room was decent- larger than average, with a couch, nice t.v., a bed typical of what we found throughout Italy, and a wardrobe w/ electronic safe (which the bellhop told us to be sure to use not less than 5 times). Bathroom was larger than average and clean, though it showed sign of water damage on the ceiling and some peeling paint. Breakfast was also standard- with good cappucino, rolls and brioches, cold meats, and juice. Overall, aside from the great location, I would agree with the two star ranking, and upon my return to Rome, will most likely look for another place to stay that allowed for some sort of outdoor respite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PicklesFarnborough
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno is the perfect location to explore Rome, 5 minutes from the Trevi ,10 minutes from the Spanish steps and all other locations such as the Pantheon , Forum, Piazza Navona and the Old Town, which should not be missed, are all within easy walking . The Hotel offers clean and comfortable accomodation. Breakfast is ok although very busy and seating limited get down early. The only thing really missing is a roof top bar to have a late drink but there are plenty of places nearby and a lack of a bar is made up by the location and the friendly hotel staff. To explore Rome I would reccomend this hotel. As this is in the business area, local restaurants are of a higher price and a 30 minute walk to the old town would see a reduction of about 50% and excellent food. Alternatively, for a unique experience, try the L'Eau Vive at Via Mongerone, 85-85a and get ready to sing for your supper.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regno....Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: nicknacks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights and the Regno, the location is fantastic for site seeing, within walking distance of everything. Our room and the common areas of the hotel were spotlessly clean and the staff were helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Diane Wright
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent - top floor with a roof terrace overlooking the main street. Staff very helpful. Excellent location for seeing all the main attractions in Rome on foot, no need for buses/taxis. Food of course is excellent although can be expensive. If you can afford to get a guide when visiting the Colosseum and Vatican do so, if only to beat the long queues. Fell in love with Rome hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Oxfordeddie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. Good value and in a brilliant location. The rooms are quiet and the staff are friendly. Although they speak good English, they are happy to speak to you in Italian if you're up for it- this is a rare quality amongst Italians who generally prefer to insult you with their cheesy English than listen to the dulcet tones of the few cultured Anglo-Saxons who can speak Italian. Anyway, back to the review. The only complaint is that the rooms are narrow as space is such a premium in this city-centre location. Otherwise, well worth booking. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Regno a worry”
Reviews.Author: jasperMelbourne
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Regno we were showed to our room which was like a box and obviously hadnt been cleaned properly as someone elses toothpaste was in the bathroom.I expressed our concerns to reception and were told we could be moved to a better room the next day - I said that would be good and I would pay any extra .Breakfast was a tragic affair in an overcrowded room with little air - the only plus of the Regno were the staff at breakfast who really tried hard to please.Surprisingly there was no mention of moving to another room and on checking out were not even helped out to the cab with our bags. I would not stay at the Regno again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place for family and walking ditance to everything you can do in Rome for”
Reviews.Author: schultzie05
Reviews.Content: This place is located two minutes from the Trevi fountain, minutes from great restaurants and 10 minutes from the Colosseum, the Patheon. Can't beat it Great continental breakfast and rooms . Everything you need is in this hotel! Hard to find something better I would say!!

Reviews.Title: “So central”
Reviews.Author: BeHappyM8
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Regno because it had been recommended to us due to its location. And its location was superb. 5 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and 5 minutes the other direction to the Pantheon. Another 5 minutes on takes you to Piazza Navona. All very well sign posted. Check in was efficient and service helpful. Breakfast was served in a lovely “outside” terrace and although smallish and busy, the service was engaging and coffee came the way we asked for. Choices of breakfast was good and plentiful. Our room, a double classic room No 350, was a beautiful introduction to Italy. A comfortable double bed in a good size room with another smaller room with another TV. The bathroom was big enough and the shower was hot and strong. A balcony with room for 2 to have a glass of wine overlooking one of the numerous restaurant alleys of this area of Rome topped off a great hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: CB-UK
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay at the Regno Hotel. We had actually booked into another hotel which upon arrival was over 10 metro stops from the centre of Rome in a terrible area and not safe for two females travelling alone and so decided we had to move after one night. From entering the Regno hotel and explaining our situation to the reception staff they were fantastically helpful from the very start, even offering us transport back to our old hotel and picking us up again with our luggage to ensure our safety. The twin room we were given was lovely, clean and beautifully presented with a roof terrace overlooking the Via Del Corso. All the staff we encountered from the reception onwards were incredibly helpful and the location is fantastic 5 minutes walk from the Pantheon, 10 minutes from the Spanish steps in Piazza Spagna, 35 minutes walk to St Peters, 20 minutes from the Colosseum. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Rome and will definitely be returning on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Good location & service”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller49
Reviews.Content: Very good location for walking tour of Rome...Minutes to Trevi fountain and comfortable walk to many other city sites. The service at reception was efficient and the room had everything. Internet through the TV was a wait of time and money...Very slow! We found out too late that we could have organised a 'packed breakfast' as we departed before 7am. The cafe next door was very friendly and had a good range at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “So central”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMask
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November 07. This hotel is so centrally located we walked to all the sights including the Vatican. Staff were very helpful especially the breakfast room staff. They remembered what coffee we wanted every morning. the rooms are small but why would you want to stay there all day when there is so much to see. Enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great little gem!”
Reviews.Author: RealTimeTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally located boutique-style hotel. If you like to stroll around interesting city sights, then it's the one for you. It's very convenient for dining out and shopping as well. Service is very good, the staff were very friendly & helpful (in the italian way, best to do some research and understand their culture). Although, not all staff are able to understand english, a few phrases from my italian phrasebook managed to do the trick. I had a pleasant stay at this hotel and would come back again if I go to Rome next time. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location”
Reviews.Author: meltina_8
Reviews.Content: Rome: Hotel Regno - "Excellent" Date: 4th May 2008 Reviewer: Maria, Malta. Stayed in quad room ( 2 adults/2 children). Comfortable. Quiet at night in spite of being on a main road. Staff very cordial and helpful. But the best thing is the location. Safe area. It is within walking distance from everywhere we wanted to go. There are so many things to see that it's a pity to miss them if travelling by metro. Reception will provide you with a very good map. Breakfast was very good and abundant too. I would recommend Hotel Regno to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “No can do, Mr. Paying-Guest”
Reviews.Author: HydeWhite
Reviews.Content: What a superb location, on the Corso. What a charming little hotel. What a tiny sweatbox of a room for $285/night. You see there's no need to have the air-conditioning on in Rome at the end of March. It just doesn't get hot enough. OK, well it's 24C (75F) out there, but in here, in this sunfree, compact and bijoux room, there's no need to lower the temperature, surely. The fridge? The room's fridge is kicking out a load of heat and the room is sweltering? "But Sir, it's only the end of March". If you're after service that puts you first plus a room where you don't shut the bathroom door as you bend over to brush your teeth, try elsewhere. This hotel gets an OK rating for its location and attentive breakfast staff. The problem is a clueless management who think it can thrive or survive with honest reviews like this one.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: colliegirl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for easy access to most things. The rooms are small but adequate, the staff tried to be as helpful as they could be and some of the front desk people were really on the ball we didn't have to ask them twice about anything. We booked it through Tourcrafters and got a much lower rate then advertised. The breakfast was okay, ham, cheese, salami, yogurt, fruit, bread and rolls and the strongest coffee ever. You can almost stand a spoon up in it. Don't hesitate to give the Regno a try.

Reviews.Title: “great location waitresses are rude”
Reviews.Author: tnaIllinois
Reviews.Content: There were waitresses that poured coffee on my mom and then she said "prago and bonjorno" she sounded like donatella versace other than that it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: at_doha
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent !!. It is only walking distance to all major sights (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Forum, etc). Since the hotel is located along the main shopping artery, then shopping is very convenient. Our quad room is big and comfortable for our family of 4, with 2 teen girls. Breakfast is also satisfactory. Front office staff is also helpful, almost in every ways.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Eve1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for a few nights in Decenber 2007 and the location was perfect. I had never been to Rome before and I wanted to cram as much as possible into my short stay there. We visited all the major sites and walked everywhere, this is the main reason why I would recommend this hotel as it is central to everything, literally 5 mins from both the Trevi and the Pantheon. It took us approx. 30 mins to walk to the Vatican area and that was strolling along. The hotel has a friendly and efficient reception staff, likewise in the breakfast room. The room itself was very clean, quiet, although on a main road and warm. If you want to stay in central Rome then this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller2008
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our fourth trip to Rome and our third stay at Hotel Regno and would recommend it not only for the perfect location ( everywhere within walking distance ) but the standard of the service and hotel rooms. Our rooms have always been a decent size and very comfortable and the staff especially Reception,Breakfast and Bar staff have always been very pleasant and helpful. Perfect ! The Corcoran Family Cheshire. UK

Reviews.Title: “"Location Location Location "”
Reviews.Author: hawk21
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 day stay at Hotel Regno. Booked this hotel through 1800hotels.ie at a good rate. My husband son and I stayed here. We required to book 2 rooms and I was looking for reasonable priced accomodation in a central location in Rome. The Regno did not leave me down. Its location is just fantastic right on Via del Corso , 3 min walk tops to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon .The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Booking online one does not get the best rooms anyway !!!!!! ( if I had booked direct through hotel it would have cost twice the price) The breakfast in morning was continental and with plenty of variety and plenty of food available. If you want good value accomodation in Central location to major sites in Rome look no further than Regno.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Grahamarb
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Regno in Rome. The location is perfect, within walking distance of major sights such as the Pantheon and Trevi fountain. The hotel is very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A previous reviewer criticized the breakfast. That is unwarranted. The breakfast was more than satisfactory. All sorts of coffee, pastries, cereal, yoghurts, cheese and cold cuts. No one could ask for more. The hotel is on a main street, the via Corso. However, the room was very quiet. If we ever have the good fortune to go to Rome again, we will stay at the Hotel Regno.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location No problems”
Reviews.Author: Barry Lynch
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be in just about the best location in Rome, within easy walking of the Trevi Fountain, which is just across the road, with the Spanish steps and prime shopping of the Via Condotti just up the road, and the narrow lanes leading to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Piazza Campo di Fiori just behind the hotel. The hotel does the job, although the rooms are on the smallish side. If you want more space, and the weather is good, ask for Room 660 which has an excellent flower decked patio overlooking the Via del Corso. Would be great for sipping Barolo on a summer evening in the declining orange light.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: bgsnowsports
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into the Hotel Verona but got overbooked and moved here. How lucky we where, the hotel is comfortable, excellent location and very friendly staff. Great breakfast to start the day. Would reccommend this hotel without any hesitation and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5!”
Reviews.Author: myri53
Reviews.Content: such a cute little hotel.. i shared a room with my brother and sister and we had a nice big bed each, and even though our room was a bit small, it didnt bother us, as we were hardly ever at the hotel anyway.. the breakfast was the best part though!!! so much selection!! the little yoghurts were the best! nice big bathroom... very friendly staff!! we had a front room so we could see what was going on outside.. within walking distance from the trevvy fountain & colosseum..i'd definately go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Less than helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: luzer
Reviews.Content: booked through gtahotels.com the best thing about this hotel is the location. literally on one of the main streets of downtown rome, walking distance to many attractions. tourist information booth across the street. the concierge staff was less than helpful. didn't look up as we walked in, didn't explain themselves, overall - nothing great. wait staff was better. breakfast was ok. also - night tour we booked through them was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved it!"”
Reviews.Author: kathryn7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regno for five nights in late September and loved everything about it. The position was fantastic - such a central location. We had two rooms both of which were extremely clean and comfortable and the breakfast room was a lovely way to start the day. Guisseppe and Roberto on the front desk were very welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them. We would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: linzee14
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno is in the best location of Rome. We were recently there for 2 nights during our honeymoon and we couldn't have picked a better location. We walked to the colosseum, trevi fountain, the spanish steps, and even to the Vatican! The hotel was not the most modern, but it was clean and the staff was friendly and the room was a nice size with a terrace. The decor didn't look like it had been updated in awhile, but while you are in Rome how much time do you really spend in your hotel? I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabfourty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect base to explore the fantastic city of Rome. My Dad & I stayed here during our short break & were really pleased with the hotel's location, very central to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Step's, etc. Our rooms were clean & comfortable, breakfast in the morning was pretty good too. TOP TIP- The Vatican is well worth a visit & works out much cheeper if you go on the local bus rather than on the organised trip's, it's really no hassle as the bus stop's right outside & we saved 35Euro's each!!! Also, buy a Radio Tour Guide when you purchase your entry ticket to tell you about every thing. Comfy shoe's are a must too, lot's of walking. Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Splendid Regno”
Reviews.Author: fivetimesayear
Reviews.Content: What a Hotel, the Regno has everything you need for a splendid stay in a wonderful city. My wife and I stayed here, with another couple from the 9th till the 12th of September, we chose this hotel from recommendations on Tripadvisor. The Regno couldn't be more central, if you draw a straight line between theTrevi fountain and the Panthanon, where it crosses the Via del Corso, you will find the Regno. We were allocated rooms 550 and 552, located at the front of the hotel, both had small balconies overlooking the main road, we were never troubled with any traffic noise. The rooms had been recently refurbished to a very high standard, solid wood floors and a beautiful bathroom, double bed, free safety deposit box, plenty of hanging space and very roomy. The breakfast was exceptional, exactly what you come to expect from a continental hotel, with plenty of choice and all of the best quality. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, we used two resturants that they recommended and the were both top quality. Grill and Wine and the Hostaria Romano, both near the Trevi fountain. This is probably the best 2 or 3 star hotel that we have ever stayed in, and we travel to Europe at least 6 times each year. Try it, and you will never stay anywhere else in Rome, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Regno fantastico !!!”
Reviews.Author: tonyWigan
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to rome & we couldnt have picked a better hotel. 100 metres from trevi fountain, everything else within walking distance. We booked it because of recommendations on this website & we were not disappointed. If we ever go back we will definitely stay here again. Rooms clean, breakfast was ok (needs a more powerful toaster though :-). Rooms air conditioned & double glazed. Safes were free. Staff friendly & helpful. We stayed for 5 nights & it was not long enough to see everything. Rome is such a fantastic place with something around every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tymetraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for 3 nights, (August 14 to 17). We had some concerns when we first booked, as we normally stay at the Hyatt or Marriott. However the prices in Rome were extremely high in comparision to North American standards, and I could not justify the extra cost. The reception area is small, and we had to take 2 different, very small elevators to get to our room. The room was very comfortable, my wife and I slept in the pull out sofa and the kids slept in the 2 single beds. It was a good size room for Europe, both the room and bathroom were very clean. We stayed on the 5th floor facing Via del Corso, and room was very quiet considering we were facing the main street. The A/C worked well, and we had a nice little balcony, which served us well in the morning. We did try the buffet breakfast one morning (located on the second floor), but it was not that good, so we walked across the road and picked up some fresh pastries, coffee, and enjoyed breakfast on our balcony with a nice view of Rome. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and made good recommendations for restaurants at night. The Regno was within easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Emmanuel Monument in Piazza Venezia and the Pantheon. Plus many restaurants and cheap pizzerias. Overall my family was very happy with the hotel, and we would recommend the Regno, and will stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a city of materpieces”
Reviews.Author: SStamp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regno from 19th to 26th August 07. I stayed in room 350 which had a double bed and a single in a little adjoining room. The bathroom was large with a lovely big shower, bath, bidet and sink area. I had a lovely big balcony, so big infact, it had two sets of double glazed and traditionally wooden shuttered french doors. There was also air conditioning, pay for view movies and free (although intermittent) internet access. The bed was lovely and comfortable and there was lots of closet space, but not enough hangers. The view looked onto the neighbouring building, but also down onto the streets below where there were markets during the day and diners eating out at night. The only downside was that I found its position on Via del Corsa extremely noisy. The hotel's position is perfectly situated for upscale shopping, tourist souvenir shopping, the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps - a really great location. The continental breakfast was pretty dire, and the fruit jiuce (from a machine) was undrinkable. The coffee was very nice however and there were meats and cheese. The staff, especially Gabriele were just wonderful. I could not have asked for more friendly, helpful, accomodating people. They directed me to places, ordered me cars, booked restaurants, chased up tour companies - allsorts of everything - they could not have been better. House-keeping were good and gave me lots of little toiletries whenever I was running low. I had the best time in Rome and this was very much to do with the service I received at the Regno. I would have no hesitation in returning there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all....”
Reviews.Author: JerryLosAngeles_Ca_
Reviews.Content: I'm a little spoiled, (we are Starwood hotel members) so I'm not used to smaller hotels, but this place was pretty darn nice. The service was excellent, the location is better than great ,and the rooms are nicely decorated. We had two rooms (one for the kids), and as promised, they were next to each other. The rooms were on the noisy street side of the hotel yet there wasn't any street noise in the room. The air conditioning was cold, and the breakfast was fine. I don't have any of the complaints that some of the other reviewers have. It was actually a very good place to stay for the start of our two week Italian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Glennys
Reviews.Content: A rather small but quaint hotel on the via del Corso. We had been warned Hotel rooms in Rome were rather small so we were pleasantly surprised at the large size of both the rooms we had ( we had a broken trip with a cruise in the middle of our stay). The staff were helpful and friendly and spoke good english. The location was perfect. It was within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and the Collosseum. It was very handy to some great eating places and about 2mins walk to an Irish Pub! Bus stop outside the front door for trips to Vatican City and a 10 min ride to the Termini. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Chickle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for 4 nights for my mums 60th birthday. The best thing about this hotel by far is the location. Everything is on your doorstep. We found all of the reception staff exceptionally friendly and helpful, giving us help, directions, booking taxis etc whenever we needed it. They wouldn't even let us carry our cases anywhere, it was all done for us. Ok the rooms are a little tired, but they are very clean and for a three star hotel anyone who expects the Ritz are being unrealistic. A bit of stained wallpaper is not going to ruin your holiday! The air con was great, there was no road noise as the windows were so good. It's hard to find fault. The only down sides to this hotel were the showers, although good and hot and powerful, the cubicles are tiny and the bathroom gets completely flooded. Also the breakfasts, as someone has previously mentioned the fruit juices are disgusting! But the thing that really annoyed me was the breakfast lady with the dark frizzy hair, who was extremely rude. On the day of my mums 60th birthday we tried to move a table 6 inches over to another one so that the 5 of us could breakfast together and she came marching over, shouting at us in Italian and would not even let us sit together. It's a shame that one member of staff can let an otherwise brilliant hotel down so badly. Overall though, if you can avoid that woman, I thoroughly recommend this as an excellent hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestYorkshireScooby
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we thought it would be a very central place to walk to the many sites in Rome and we were right! We walked everywhere. The room was clean, we had a fantastic terrace (but with so much to see and do in the city we didn't use this too much). The breakfast really set us up for the day with a great choice of food. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms a little tired though”
Reviews.Author: OliStoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the start of June. Found the rooms a little tired looking (ripped wallpaper). Location was excellent - just around the corner from the Trevi fountain. Also walked to Spanish Steps. My biggest winge would be about breakfast...bad coffee, juice from a machine (i.e. powder mixed with water). Just head out and grab breakfast somewhere else in the city. Other than that I'd recommend it for what it is due to location.

Reviews.Title: “convenient Regno”
Reviews.Author: alfie92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regno for 02nights on our 1st trip to Rome. We found this hotel and checked on tripadvisor and the reviews were fine. We booked the flights through easyjet who offered a city shuttle bus you could pre book for 14 euros rtn each. The shuttle bus was well organised and ran every 30 mins, and the bus dropped you of at the main train termini. We got a taxi then from here to our hotel which took us around 10mins, We were ripped off!!! he charged us 27 euros, it was our fault we didnt ask a price when we got into the taxi, our return journey back to the train termini was 8 euros! On arriving to the hotel we were given a room on the 5th floor overlooking the side street with a lovely little balcony and we could see over the roof tops of Rome.The room was very compact but clean and the bathroom had a shower over the bath which again was very clean. We had continental breakfast included in the price which was adequate. The hotel is in a excellent location very easy to walk to the Trevi fountain and we also walked to the Spanish steps. There are lovely restaurants all around the hotel and its also very accessible to all the shops. Would recommend the open- top city tour bus, 20 euros each, this is a hop on- hop off service which goes around all the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: jankoke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our rooms was very clean, quiet and fairly large. 3 beds and a separate room for watching TV. The lobby is small and cramped and getting around to find your room was impossible. The hotel continental breakfast was average. The best part about this place was its ease to get around the great sites of Rome: 2 blocks from the Trevi, 4 blocks to Pantheon and Novona Square and 1/4 mile to the Steps and Ara Pacis. The resturants were all over the place. The staff was fairly nice. I would DEFINATELY stay again!!!! The price was bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DevonShazzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and thought we were lucky to be right in the historical centre. Everythng we wanted to see was within walking distance for us and there are numerous takeaway eateries, shops and restaurants literally round the corner for all price ranges. You also have the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and lovely piazzas within a very short stroll. If you wish to travel by bus further afield, the bus stop is right outside! The hotel was very clean, the staff were friendly and the buffet style breakfast perfectly ok. You have to pay extra for a cooked breakfast. Our room was a perfectly good size with a king size bed and the bathroom was clean and had a great power shower. We were overlooking the main road but the room had double glazing so we were't affected by any traffic noise. We did find the plumbing a little noisy. You could hear loos flushing and people showering which was fine as long as it wasn't in the middle of the night. We were under the impression that the rooms had balconies and that there was a roof terrace but this wasn't the case. The staff said that unless you booked specific rooms or a suite, you didn't get either. It didn't spoil our enjoyment of Rome at all as we didn't spend that much time at the hotel and so the balcony/roof terrace became irrelevant but beware if you really wanted one! Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: footloose_farang
Reviews.Content: Being just on the edge of the Centro Historico its ideally placed for that part of Rome. Our double room was small but comfortable but with a tiny tiny shower which tended to flood the bathroom and would have flooded the bedroom without our towel dam! However my wife and daughter stayed there in January and had much larger rooms As a base from which to explore Rome its ideal. Pantheon just down the street, The Trevi, Campo del Fiori, Piazza Navona etc etc just a short walk away. Also handy for buses to and from most other sites and to Termini. Continental breakfast was reasonably comprehensive, but don't have the standard coffee in a jug, possibly the worst coffee in Rome and why drink that when the Gran Cafe is just down the side street next to the hotel! Be sure to arrive early for breakfast as the restaurant gets packed out after about 8am Staff are very friendly and helpful. Front rooms can be noisy as the hotel is directly on the Via del Corso but side rooms have the advantage of a view of the busy, pavement restaurant and cafe filled alleyway that runs along one side. Other than breakfast we didn't eat in the hotel and why would you with so many places to choose from, so only book on a B & B basis.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Regno April 4 to 11, 2007. We found the location, directly on one of Rome's main streets, to be both an advantage, and a problem. Its a great location because you are only five minutes from the Trevi Fountain and to the Pantheon both of which have numerous stores and restaurants surrounding them. On the other hand, rooms in the front can be quite noisy and the air conditioning was not yet on for the season. Ask for the back of the hotel when you book. Rooms are small but comfortable and have everything you need. The front desk personnel were very helpful with information and bookings. Breakfast is included, but eggs will cost you extra if you must. Otherwise, cereal, yougurt and pastries. The hotel has a full-service restaurant but we did not try it. If you get hungry late at night there is a late night take out pizza and a take-out store just a short walk away near the Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Selsdonricardo
Reviews.Content: We normally travel using top hotels, USA, Mauritius etc. However, this is a weekend break and the hotel is not so important. This is a typical Italian hotel - old building etc. Whilst the hotel itself is 3 star standard, this is not important. On a Rome visit, you will be out of the hotel for most of the time. Rome is very easilly seen on foot and you will do a lot of walking. This is a great city break - you need 3 nights at least to see the city - and the amount of time you spend in the hotel is minimal. The loction of the hotel is completely superb. Cannot be better. 2 mins from the Trevi fountain, 4 mins from the Pantheon and 5 mins from the fashionable Spanish Steps - plus much more closeby. Bus stops are outside (or a 100 yds to the Piazza Venezia) and you can go anywhere in Rome for 1 euro. In summer, the hotel will be hot. Air conditionig is noisy so keep the windows open during the day. Breakfast is good. Will definately use this hotel next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find!!!”
Reviews.Author: it's_a_small_world_1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in Rome at the Hotel Regno and found it to be a very comfortable and relaxing place to stay. The location of the hotel could not have been better. Within 2 minutes walk we were at the Trevi Fountain, and 5 minutes at the Pantheon (where there are some superb little restaurants for an evening meal). It is in a well lit and busy area so we felt very safe at night, but even though it was busy the double glazing in the room did an excellent job of blocking out the sounds from the road. The room was very comfortable, and clean. The shower was excellent - just what we needed after a long day on our feet. The staff are pleasant and helpful, and we particularly enjoyed the sticky pastries at breakfast - delicious! We would definitely stay here again. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rome!”
Reviews.Author: happybridetobe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel regno september two years ago and have just booked my sister and her husband in for st patricks weekend this year: its is clean with a nice restaurant and nice rooms but very small as they are in the eu. bathroom was of hotel standard no mildew etc perfect if you do not want to spend alot of time in your hotel but do want to feel like you are staying in a hotel when you are there it is lovely! hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: EvertheOptimist
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and our second stay at the Regno. Pleased to say we were just as impressed as we were the first time! Different room, but just as clean, functional and comfortable as the previous one. Contrary to many of the previous posters, we found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and extremely competent at their jobs. The Reception staff were always very willing to book taxis, make restaurant suggestions and reservations and they always answered our queries in a friendly and helpful way. The man who served meals and ran the bar on an evening even remembered us from our previous visit and what we wanted to drink - top marks to him!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. The location is great-very central and just minutes to many of the must-sees. The rooms are clean and comfortable (you have too much to see and do to be spending much time in them anyway), and the staff are lovely. What more do you need from a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Buzbyago
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. The hotel is brilliantly located, within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions. Hotel was very clean and our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable for 3 adults. Only down side I would say is that there is nothing to do in the evening at the hotel, no bar, no coffee facilities or tv to watch (unless you like Sky/BBC news). We like to come back to the hotel of an evening and sit down and relax with a coffee to end the day off, but we just had to go to bed as there was nowhere else to sit. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, one of them even came out to translate instructions to a taxi driver we were having problems making ourselves understood to. All in all a very good hotel to stay in as a base for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “worn out”
Reviews.Author: zaccaria
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Hotel Regno. What the other posters say is correct: the location is very convenient. However, the hotel is run down and not well maintained. Upholstery and wall coverings were stained and ripped. Breakfast was ordinary, much of the china was chipped. Most of the staff I encountered were barely civil. Looked like it had seen better days. A disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ROBBJOHN
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Hotel Regno. On check-in I asked if there were any rooms available with a balcony. The friendly staff checked availability and we were given a room with 2 balconies overlooking the street. It was an excellent room, very clean, although I left the balcony doors open at night and it was noisy. The continental breakfast was quite sufficient and the area was pleasant. Great thing about the location of the hotel is we were within walking distance (about 5 min.) to the Trevi Fountain. The Pantheon and Colosseo and Roman Forum were also within walking distance. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location...BUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: xpis3
Reviews.Content: On July 2006 I visited Rome with 2 family members, all of us adults. Before deciding which hotel to stay I searched the member's opinions more 3-4 times. Finally after reading a member's review about staying twice in the hotel, I decided to stay at the Regno. I would like to share our experience with you. We got a room for 3. When we checked in the receptionist told me that we have separate toilet and bathroom, and that we have a balcony. When the bell-boy opened the door, we saw a short corridor and in the end the room itself. The corridor has 2 doors opposite each other – one for the bathroom and the other for the toilet. While the toilet was roomy the bathroom was tiny. There was no pegs to hang the cloths, the 2 shelves are opposite the sink, and very high. As I am the tallest of the 3 of us, I was the only one who could use the shelves, and even than only be standing on my toes. The closet is near the entry door, there is one shelf, and one rod to hang and put one cloth. Here too the rod and the shelf are so high that I was the only one who used the closet, and to reach the shelf I had to stand on my toes. Apart from the closet there are only 2 small drawers, and the other 2 had to leave all their cloths and other things in the suitcase. Very uncomfortable when you stay few days in one hotel. On the first day I asked for one more chair. They did not give us one, when I reminded reception about it on the second day, it did not help. On the third day the receptionist told me that they don't have any spare chairs in the hotel and that we have to seat on the bad. When I said that we would like to seat on the balcony he said: "your problem". On the second day we discovered that something is wrong with the air-condition, and that it makes a lot of noise. I called reception but they did not send a technician. On the next day when we went out I reminded reception about the problem with it, and the receptionist (this time a woman) said that she will look into it. When we came back it was not fixed. I call again and she sent the bell-boy. He tried to do his best, but he could not fix it. When I asked him to tell reception to send a technician he said: better you ask them, whey won't heed me saying it. So I called them. But next day, again after reminding them about it in the morning, they did not do anything. Only on the fourth day after I got really angry with them they sent the technician who did his best, and at least he eliminated the noise. To sum it up – the location is unbeatable; the breakfast was very good; the receptionists are rude and uncooperative, especially the blond woman; the hotel amenities not the ones you find in a good 3 stars hotel. I don't think that we ever stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not the best”
Reviews.Author: chocdeb
Reviews.Content: Several people recommended this hotel to us, but when we arrived we were disappointed. The location was good but the room was small and the walls were paper thin! The bathroom was old and tired. Breakfast was okay. Overall the hotel did not live up to our expectations, except for the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Morningsider
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on my recent trip to Rome. Turned out to be an ideal spot to have as a base if you wanted to see some of the best sights of Rome. The hotel is located on the via del Corso (one of the main streets in Rome). It is quite a busy shopping area. There are plenty of pizzerias around the hotel. It is a five minute walk to the Fontana di Trevi and the Palazzo Venizia, ten minutes to the Pantheon and the Piazza di Spagna and about ten to fifteen to the Colosseum. The hotel staff are quite friendly and willing to help with directions, etc.. The city's traffic is quite disorganised, watch out for the scooters that whiz past you on pedestrian crossings without stopping. Most of the tour operators provide hotel pick-ups. However, they do not drop you off at the doorstep of your hotel but at the nearest possible landmark. In the case of the Regno, this would be the Palazzo Venizia or via Tomacelli. For motor racing freaks, there is a Ferrari store on via Tomacelli (ten minute walk from the hotel). The breakfast options are quite good, served from 07:00. On the whole, it was quite a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “They moved us to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela2336
Reviews.Content: Plumbing problems are their overused excuse to switch you to their other property. We booked this hotel for 4 nights and 2 rooms for a stay in mid July, 2005. The reservations were made by a friend who knew the manager. On the way from the airport, the driver handed me his cell phone and I was informed that due to "plumbing problems" they were moving us to the Hotel Oxford. I felt that we had no choice so the driver took us there. Although we never stayed at the Hotel Regno, this bait and switch made me feel like they were taking advantage of us. We stayed one night at the Oxford and the next morning we checked into the Hotel Minerva which is fabulous. We were not going to take any chances that the "plumbing problems" were not repaired. The hotel Oxford was far from everything we wanted to see and the rooms were small. They charged us the same as if we had stayed at the Regno. Shame on them!

Reviews.Title: “Your Taking Chances”
Reviews.Author: BarryPatch
Reviews.Content: "WE HAVE A SLIGHT PROBLEM WITH YOUR ROOM" That was our greeting as we attempted to check in. We were told that there was a plumbing problem and we' d be provided with a room at their other property, Hotel Oxford. If I'd wanted to stay there, I would have. I told them that I wouldn't accept that and insisted on "my room" and that I could have been easily contacted via e-mail and notified of the overbooking, oops, I mean "plumbing" problem before my arrival. Read the other reviews and you'll find that this is not an anomaly ( I wrongly assumed it was). Our fifth floor front room was very nice with a great balcony over Corso St. It's very noisy on Saturday nights if that's an issue. If you choose to stay here confirm your confirmation, as I did, a couple weeks in advance. If they try to move you, insist on your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: Dooleysmum
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Regno and were very happy with our choice of Hotel. Our room was just great, lovely decor and we had our own little balcony which overlooked a delightful street full of cafes. Our room was spotlessly clean as was our bathroom. The room was very quiet at night with very heavy drapes to drown out any street noise. The hotel itself is a bit of a rabbit warren to get used to finding your way around but all in all a perfect place to stay when visiting Rome as it is so well situated, within walking distance of most of the famous sites. We will be very happy to return to Hotel Regno when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dommich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Rome. The location of this hotels was perfect. Within walking distance of just about everything. The hotels was clean and they serviced the rooms daily. In room internet was convenient. The breakfast was the same as everywhere else. Edible but not fabulous. The staff went out of their way to help us book day trips and plan our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: RandomTravellerz
Reviews.Content: We happened to be staying at the Hotel Regno when Italy won the World Cup! What a great place to be at that time! We loved our stay at the Regno and will most definately stay there again the next time we go to Rome (we threw coins in the Trevi so we are destined!)! We splurged on two rooms, one for ourselves and one for our two teenage sons. Their room had a lovely balcony which my husband and I utilized. Our room across the hall, had no balcony, but was a bit larger and still had a lovely view. From our room we were treated to live orchestral music each night, coming from the nearby piazza. The breakfast was wonderful (great coffee) and the front desk very helpful. The location cannot be beat. We walked to everything, including from the train station as the taxis were on strike when we arrived (a good argument for packing light and each having only one bag). The only time we felt the need to use public transport was to the Vatican. We took the bus - easy, easy, no problem at all. If you are reading this and are considering a stay at the Regno and have looked at their website, it is as wonderful as it seems, and I am very excited for you and your trip to Rome! Buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann003
Reviews.Content: just came back from a 4 night stay at the regno. could not fault the hotel the reception staff were friendly and on arrival our cases were taken up to our room by the porter. the room was clean with a bath and shower on suite. there was air conditioning in the room which was marvellous as it was very hot on a night. we were at the front of the hotel which is situated on a busy main road, but as there are a double set of windows in the room we could not here any noise whatsoever. the hotel is very central for all attractions and shops, everything is within walking distance except the vatican which takes about 15 mins on the number 62 bus which stops outside the hotel. I could not fault this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Beti_Mal
Reviews.Content: For a city centre hotel we found the Regno to be a great base for our four night stay in Rome. Our room, if a little small, was perfectly comfortable and clean with a minibar, air con/heating and TV/internet access to add to the comfort of the stay. The only real problem we encountered was the noise. The wall between us and the room next door was incredibly thin, so much so, we could here the man next door snoring! We were also opposite the kitchen which did get rather noisy first thing in the morning. Inevitably in a city centre you will get noise outside the hotel but we were woken at around 5am by the sound of glass bottle being emptied out of a bin. After the first night we invested in some ear plugs and this put an end to the problems. I would recommend asking for a room higher than the first floor in order to minimise noise levels. The breakfast was good, plenty of choice, good coffee etc. We didn't eat at the hotel in the evening as there's so much choice in Rome, we wanted to explore other places. Certainly, the best thing about this hotel was its location. We walked everywhere during our time there. One tip, if you do take a taxi, watch out as we were duped by a taxi driver upon arrival at the Termini Station. Keep an eye on what bank note you give them as our taxi driver told us otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor service”
Reviews.Author: RGARCIAMD
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms. My wife and daughter in one, my son and I in another. My wife's room smelled really bad, and my room's air conditioner did not work. The staff did not go out of their way to solve any of these problems. It seems the hotel is severely understaffed. I would not choose this hotel again. The location is very good, the rooms are small

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - No problems!”
Reviews.Author: Harmon31
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here May 21-25th, we had two triple rooms. The rooms are small, but by European standards they were big. The staff was very helpful and freindly. Breakfast was small but fine, it would have been nice to have some variation from day to day. The dining staff was very quick and freindly! The rooms were clean, A/C worked fine, and we had plenty of hot water! The lobby is small and they could use a faster elevator! We were on the 5th floor and could sit outside and watch the crowd walk in the street below us.. very nice after a long day of touring Rome! Perfect location! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “As they say Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BJC49
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Regno, one prior and four post a Mediterranean Cruise, in May / June. One could not ask for a better location for your Rome stay, it is literally 5 or 6 minutes walk from every “attraction” you would want to visit in the Old Town, and 12 minutes and 1 Euro on the number 62 Bus to St Peters, which stops outside both, coming and going, simply the best. While the hotel is in an old building, actually two buildings, with one small lift, however the rooms are quite up to date and clean, however SMALL, and our bathroom was TINY, the trade off was the location. There was Air Con on in both the rooms we had, and access to the Internet through an interactive TV and keyboard in your room at 3 Euro for 30 minutes, which is a bargain having just paid the minimum of $70US for 90 minutes on the Cruise. The staff were mostly helpful, but like most service providers in Rome, from Shops, Restaurants, Hotels, Bars and the people selling from Stalls, all seemed to treat Tourists, especially anyone that spoke only English, as an annoyance rather then as the major provider of their livelihood. Breakfast was ok, but then we had just come off a Cruise, so our opinions are influenced by what we had just experienced. There are a couple of levels of Rooms you can book, so if you want space than go for the Suites, if you want cheap then you will get small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KKmad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno from 23rd – 27th May 2006. The location of this hotel is fabulous. It is right in the heart of it all and we were able to do all the famous sites by foot and had lovely, reasonably priced restaurants at the door step. Our room was very small and at first I thought I we would not beable to sleep in the bed together – it wasn’t queen size but a bigger than a double. It was nicely decorated and clean - adequate for the two of us and the double glazed windows illuminated the street noise sufficiently to get a good nights sleep. Breakfast as adequate with a selection of juices, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, meat, cheese, breads, pastries etc - Unfortunately the reception staff were not very friendly and we got the feeling that we were an inconvenience to them. Each time before we’d passed through we would take bets on whether we could get a smile out of one of then – but it never happened. It di give a good laugh though. That aside – we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location in beautiful Rome!”
Reviews.Author: maudsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for 5 nights and honestly couldn't fault it. The location was perfect. Yes, it's on a very busy main road, but this didn't bother us at all (even though we are used to living in a very quiet neighbourhood). We were holidaying with a friend who had a single room, located at the back of the hotel overlooking the breakfast room conservatory. We occupied a twin room overlooking Via del Corso. Both rooms were excellent. We had no problems with the hot water - there was plenty at all times. The air conditioning was also switched on and working well (most welcome as the weather was scorching!) There was a good selection of pastries, yogurts, bread & ham etc on the breakfast buffet. The reception staff were brilliant - dealing with our request for an extra mattress straight away. Also, the restaurant they recommended for good pizza - L'Archetto - was brilliant (and did great panna cotta!). Well, we all threw our coins in the Trevi fountain, and when we return to beautiful Rome, we'll definitely stay at the Regno. We recommend it to anyone wanting a decent hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Service at Regno left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at the Regno after our experience there. My husband and I arrived at the Hotel Regno which we had booked and paid for through our Travel Agent on a Saturday for a four night stay. Our friends were with us and they had booked their room on the Internet so they had not paid anything for the room. We arrived at reception to be told that there was water damage in our rooms and they were going to move us to their other hotel which was 20 minutes walk behind the Spanish Steps and we were also told it was near shops. (Yes it was but Via Veneto shops - all very expensive) and also near the American Embassy. They seemed to think we were Americans and it was a big deal to stay by the Embassy. After a lot of discussion we were put into a taxi and sent to the Hotel Oxford. Once there we found out after a lot of discussion again that we could move back to the Hotel Regno the next day - funny how the rooms were going to be ready after the weekend was over. My husband and I were going on a early morning tour on the Sunday morning and decided to stay at the Oxford because of this but our friends moved back to the Regno. The whole experience marred our enjoyment of Rome as we felt we were at their mercy because we had prepaid for the Regno and had no choice but to go to the Oxford. The Oxford was out of the way and we had to taxi or walk quite a way to get to the sights of Rome.
