The Regno reception staff didn't give a hoot about what we wanted - they told us we would be upgraded at the Oxford but the room at the Regno that our friends moved back to was definitely a nicer room than those at the Oxford. We felt that the reason we were moved was because the hotel had been overbooked. We had booked our room 6 months prior to our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant experience with this hotel. It's not super fancy, but the staff was helpful (spoke English), room was clean and location was perfect. We could walk nearly everywhere in Rome from our hotel. The street was a little busy, so it was a little loud at night and in the morning with traffic and people noise. Breakfast was good - pastries, cereal, juics, and some meat and cheese. Seemed like there were better food choices early in the morning. Table seating was a little limited. They held our baggage when we arrived and on our departure day. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location-good value”
Reviews.Author: Italiandream
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Regno at Via Del Corso 330 . Room #452 quad room with seperated pocket doors.and terrace @250 Euro's a night. Very pleased with hotel! Perfect location, nestled in between Trevi fountain and the Pantheon. Restaurants, shopping and all the action around us was great. The hotel staff was very accomodating. They have 69 rooms-small lobby and small elevator but that just added to feel and flavor of Italy. We slept well, showers were great, safes in room and with doors closed no problem hearing street traffic. Breakfast was nothing fancy but served it's purpose. We are a family of four, boys 15 and 18. We have a 4 night stay here at the Regno and then on to Sorrento & Amalfi Coast then back for one more night at Regno. Good hotel choice for us. Stayed here for a total of 5 nights on our lat night after being away we returned to same room at our request . When we arrived everyone greeted us so warmly we felt as though we never left. It was great! Best of all we already knew the layout and the surroundings

Reviews.Title: “bellissimo !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel Regno for 4 nights in November. We had a great time: The room was clean en fairly big enough. We had a great view, and did not hear the 24-hr-traffic because of double windows(!). The staff was very friendly and helpfull (called us cabs etc) and spoke English very well. The location was teriffic! Close to almost everything (specially Pantheon, Trevi Fountain (2 minutes or so), Forum Romano and Spanish Stairs (5 to 10 minutes). Longest walk (to the Vatican) took us only 20 minutes.), and surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars. PS> If you like Spagetti Carbonara you should go to the Piazza Navona and order it at the bistro situated across the largest fountain! :D

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall very pleased with this hotel - had read reviews of loads of Rome Hotels before booking and had kept fingers crossed that hadn't picked a duff one! The staff were all very friendly and spoke english. The room was very spacious with a large double bed - created from 2 large single beds - and a flat screen TV - not much in the way of english speaking channels though - mainly just the news. The room was very clean and well decorated. The bathroom was really tiny with a very small bath. It could have done with a bit of a reburbishment - the shower wasn't too good - I think others beat us to the hot water on the first morning and the pressure was down. OK on the 2nd morning. Still, the bathroom was clean and servicible, which is the most important factor. We were in room 554 - on the 5th floor overlooking the main road. It was VERY VERY noisy. The first night we didn't sleep because of the bus, car and ambulance noises that continuously hammered up and down the road. This was the worst bit about our overall stay, as we couldn't feel well rested and couldn't even contemplate a snooze in the afternoon to recover, as their was no let up in the traffic. Breakfast was OK - nothing to write home about - bread, croissant, ham, salami, yoghurt & cereal are all available and formed a perfectly adequate meal. The hotel is excellently situated in easy reach of a lot of main sights - the Trevi, Pizza Navona, Pantheon, etc. Overall the lack of sleep through the noise levels left us feeling drained but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff along with the sizable, clean accomodation made our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Hotel Regno in Rome. This Hotel is very Central in a main street full of shops and all the major sites are within walking distance. Five minutes to the Trevis Fountain, and approx. 15 minutes to the Collusseum. The Vatican is also walking distance but takes a little longer and you will probably need a map, but theres plenty to see on the way. The bedrooms in the Hotel are a good size, tastefully decorated and very clean. The staff were pleasant and helpful during our three night stay. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome and would recommend it to anyone wanting a centrally located Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: UK_traveller123
Reviews.Content: This is a good 3.5 star hotel, which is in a great location for those that want to see all that Rome has to offer. A couple of minutes' walk to the Trevi fountain, and the Pantheon, and maybe a few extra minutes walk to the nearest Metro stop (Barberini) if you need it. (We actually found that everything, Vatican included, was within walking distance, as long as you don't mind your feet being sore at the end of the day!) The hotel is very clean and the staff were great - polite, friendly and helpful. The breakfast is fine too, and we didn't have to queue for it on any of the 4 mornings we were there. Also, the bathroom seemed quite modern and had a power shower, and there were no problems with the hot water. Also, the rooms were not at all cold as other users have reported, they were just fine. We had a posh widescreen LCD TV too (ok, I'm easily impressed), and there's internet access for those that want it. Beware those travellers that are over 6 feet tall - you may find that your feet are hanging off the edge of the bed! Our double room was actually 2 single beds pushed together, and they were shorter than the British beds that I'm used to! Not a major problem though. The hotel is on a main street so there's no shortage of shops and places to eat and drink nearby, although it can also be a little noisy. On the other hand, our room was facing directly onto the main road (room 230, 3rd floor), but the noise certainly didn't keep us awake at night. Couldn't really fault the hotel, as long as you shop around for a good price - we used Cybertravelnetwork and got 4 nights for the price of 3, and at a pretty decent price.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: likearollingstone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Regno last August and found it to be a pleasant hotel. We caught the train into Rome (30 mins) and at only 9 Euro that was good value. The platform at Termini must be the longest in the world. When you finally get to the bus area, look for a No.175 and before boarding purchase a ticket from one of the news stands. There is a stop just near the hotel, ask for Trevi fountain stop. The hotel is friendly, especially the bell-boy Daniel, who was almost over the top with service. The rooms were not large but well serviced. There are no facilities for coffee or tea making, common in Italy, and don't expect an iron. Officially banned in Italian hotels. The breakfast area is quaint, and I suggest eating early, as some days there was a queue to get a table. The coffee at breakfast is wonderful, a fresh cappucino on demand. The position of the hotel is fantastic. 5 minutes to the Trevi, and 5 minutes the other way to the Spanish Steps. I put in some laundry on a Friday night and by Monday it had not returned. It seems that they cannot get it done over the weekends, and it was only when I enquired was this info passed onto me. The staff were overall helpfull and friendly. On our last night there, Daniel kindly made up some toasted sandwhiches after hours whilst running the small bar area. I would have no reservation in returning to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regno is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regno in April '05 for 5 nights. We changed rooms after 1 night and nothing was a problem at all! The staff were great giving us tourists local information. The location of this motel is just PERFECT. We alked to all sites including the Vatican and saw the Popes last audience. F. Liddell

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ozliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regno with my mum for 4 nights over New Years, after booking through a travel agent, and found it to be exactly what we needed. Had a minor issue with our room upon check in. After checking in early, we were advised that a room was available, but found that this was a double room, rather than a twin (which we had requested). They happily showed us another room, which had a double bed and a fold out bed. We stated that this would not be acceptable for a 4 night stay and they showed us a tiny twin room. We asked for the double in the second room to be separated, which they did. This probably means we ended up with what would be classed as a triple room. The room itself, on the thrid floor, was very comfortable and clean.The beds were brilliant and we had plenty of space to store luggage and hang washing. The bathroom looked recently renovated, with a shower, toilet and bidet. We had no problems with hot water, although found the water could not be kept on full pressure (which was excellent) for an entire shower as the alcove would flood. I agree with a previous review in that the linen, includeing towels was exceptional. Breakfast was provided and was always more than enoughy to carry us through to dinner. A selection of pastries, cold meat, cheese, yoghurt, cakes and toast was offered, along with a small selection of average tasting fruit. The breakfast room oozed ambience, with a glass ceiling, which was very convenient to check weather conditions, especially in winter! The staff were helpful and some were very friendly, with others always courteous. They were more than willing to help with directions and supplied us with a great map of Rome upon check in. Storage of luggage was also not a problem. The position of the hotel was fantastic. We walked everywhere, apart from the Vatican (although it probably could be done). There was also a great little restaurant down the alley leading to the Pantheon, which served fantastic food at very reasonable prices. There were bus stops 5 minutes down the road and tobacconists for bus tickets the same distance away. The only real negative was the busker that would plant himself opposite the hotel every night and sing the same song on a loop for hours. He was always finished by the time we anted to sleep, but was there enough that we knew the chorus of his song word for word and were seriously considering what we could throw out the window! ;) We found this hotel to be charming, comfortable, pretty much as we expected and deserving of a 3 1/2 star rating. We'd absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mrmktr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Regno for 3 nights, couldn't really fault it anyway, especially for the cheap rate i got it for on the ---- website. For a city centre location it was suprisingly nice and quiet. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard and front desk staff were nice and helpful. As for location, you couldn't do much better, next to all the decent attractions, even though still managed to get lost coming back from one of the plaza's after a few to many bottles of pinot grigo. Would i stay again if i went back to Rome-Yes ..... Also nice towels.

Reviews.Title: “No Heated Water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was just in Rome for 4 days and stayed at the Regno. The hotel itself is in an ideal location - right where you want to be. The room was clean and tidy and we found the staff helpful. The problem is the water. During the week, the water pressure and temperature was acceptable, but come Friday night there was no water pressure at all and by Saturday night there wasn't any HOT water at all. We had to shower in a trickle of cold water as there was also no pressure. I'm not kidding about the temperature of the water, it was absolutely freezing. When we called the front desk to ask if we could get another room or whether they could fix the water, they attempted to call a repairman but said there was nothing they could do about it. I honestly think this happens every weekend. The Regno needs to upgrade its water system - I will not stay there again because of this. I find it unacceptable to pay that kind of money ($150 Euro) and not be able to take a decent shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carolina7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 day holiday at the Regno. The location of this hotel can't be bettered, within walking distance of all the main attractions although we did catch a bus, no. 62, to the Vatican, from the bus stop just outside. Trevi, Pantheon and Piazza Navona just a few minutes away. We were upgraded to a very nice room with kitchenette on the fifth floor. We were on the back of the hotel and so heard none of the noise others here had complained of. The breakfast was adequate and snacks and coffees were available all day. Although we had read that there was no restaurant, we were surprised to find that dinners were served between 7 and 9pm each evening, which was useful if you were too tired to make the effort to go back out after a strenuous day! We found all the hotel staff to be very friendly and more than helpful and their English was superb. The room itself was kept very clean. Accepting that this is not on the grand five star scale, we certainly would have no hesitation in recommending it for those who want a more than adequate, centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Hotel Regno & it's location is ideal...in the heart of town!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed a week at the Hotel Regno. All 4 of us stayed in one room, which was very adequate (and hard to find in Europe). The staff was most cordial at all times and helpful to guide us to our destinations. A hearty breakfast of wonderful croissants, bread rolls, cold cuts, cheeses, fresh fruits, coffee, tea or cappuccino (made by Sarah) was a great way to start the day. We only ate one other meal during the day, plus drank wonderful Italian wine. The hotel's location is ideal...so close to many of the popular sites and a bus stop right outside the hotel door to go to other sites. Bank across the street. A tobacconist shop (to buy bus tickets) around the corner to the left. Take bus #62 to Vatican and #175 to the train station. Ride to Florence on the EuroStar Train and be there in 1-1/2 hrs. Great city to visit even on a day trip. We would definitely stay here again. Have a great time! Walsh- Orlando, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great; front desk staff is not”
Reviews.Author: BEK216
Reviews.Content: We thought the Hotel Regno, in some aspects, was great. The location can't be beat. The rooms are large and comfortable. There's an elevator, and breakfast is filling and plentiful. Unfortunately, the front desk staff seems to care very little about helping their guests. We felt like anything we asked them inconvenienced them. At one point, a hotel employee, without knocking, entered our room in the middle of the afternoon and surprised us. He quickly left without an explanation. I called the front desk and asked twice in person what the employee needed or was doing. I was completely ignored, told to ask another desk clerk, or told coldly that they would look into it - with no follow up or apology or any concern. I am sure the employee was restocking the mini bar or something legit, but it was startling when it happened and the front desk's complete lack of help and interest shocked me. Because of the attitude of these clerks, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Regno - Great location”
Reviews.Author: JCM81
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Regno during September 2005. The hotel is in a great location, near the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, night markets and walking distance (if you don't mind walking) to the Vatican. In general we found the hotel to be fine, except when we ordered a breakfast to go when we had a 6.45am pickup for a tour. The breakfast was ordered the night before, but nothing was ready and when asked, the guy on Reception was not happy when we asked him to check the kitchen. He hurriedly threw a few things into a bag - warm yoghurt, stale and sweaty croissants plus a bad attitude do not make a good service. We also found the normal breakfasts to be average when compared to other hotels. However, if you want a hotel in a great location - you cannot go past the Regno. By the way - if it looks like rain, make sure that you take your own umbrella as the hotel does not provide umbrellas for guests - something that would be appreciated and that could be charged to your room if you fail to return it. Also, watch the internet - we paid for two hours and did not get the full time and where told by Reception that it was not their problem - it was the ISP - but we paid the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Hotel Regno”
Reviews.Author: fiftyishtraveler
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Hotel Regno from September 14-Sept 17, 2005. 200euros per night per room. Two rooms were upgraded to suites complete with a terrace overlooking the street. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. For the most part I found the staff to be very helpful. They were more than willing to make tour arrangements, call taxis etc. I loved the location. One block from the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon was about one block behind the hotel. I felt completely safe both in the hotel and in Rome. I would definately recommend this hotel and I will stay there again when I return (and I will return; Rome is great). Fiftyish traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: AJO_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, minutes walk from the attractions in central Rome. The hotel is very clean and pleasantly decorated. It also has air conditioning (which works). We were fortunate to have a fifth floor room with a small roof terrace furnished with small plants. The room was small but the terrace made up for this. My only criticisms are that the front desk service was unreliable (messages not passed on) and the food at breakfast ran out before the last serving. Also, the beds are very short! On the whole it is a very good hotel and I would certainly visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal location”
Reviews.Author: ll127
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It's right down the street from the Trevi fountain and a short walk to the Roman Forums, the Colosseum, the Pantheon, and the Spanish Steps. I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are BEAUTIFUL and SPACIOUS and the area cannot be beat. It's a safe and upbeat street (Via del Corso), one of the main streets in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “really good regno”
Reviews.Author: benjaminmelton
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the regno for our first anniversary and what a stay! a brilliant hotel in the most ideal location possible!! we found the location to be the most important aspect when visiting rome. it was 1 minute walk from the trevi fountain and no more than 2 minutes from the pantheon and over five minutes from the piazza navona (three of the "must see" points in rome) our room although not huge was adequate, clean and comfortable. our balcony overlooked the trevi-pantheon walkway filled with busy little restaurants. it was very cheap (£200 for four nights!) it was only about a 20 minute walk to the collosium too. the only negatives were the bed was too short and im not even 6 foot! some of the staff werent too helpful (although never rude) and they ran out of some food at 9;50 (our fault really as its served till 10 which is quite convenient and the waitress smuggled me a do-nut from the kitchen) on the whole VERY much reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Regno: Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four booked a suite for a week in July, and we could not have been more pleased. The suite included two bedrooms and one and a half baths (one of which had a minor plumbing problem which was fixed within an hour of our reporting it), and was a good value at 200 euros per night. Breakfast was excellent every morning, and the staff was very helpful (including safekeeping for several days of passports and money which we forgot to remove from the room safe on departure). Even better than the hotel itself was the truly unbelievable location, 3 blocks from the Pantheon and 2 blocks from the Trevi fountain (and the best gelato in Rome at San Crispino). We walked everywhere in the city (except the Vatican), and the Regno was a perfect base from which to explore on foot, which is by far the best way to see Rome. My family would be happy to stay at the Regno again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieGuys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Regno at the beginning of August. Our rooms was on the 5th floor overlooking the Via Del Corso. We were lucky enough to have a small balcony - with a view up and down the whole street. Our room was more than adequate in size, as was the bathroom. The room was soundproof, and the standard of cleaning was spotless. Breakfast was probably one of the best we had in Italy during our month stay - and the restaurant area where it was served was bright and and really charming.. The staff were excellent, and more than willing to assist if asked. When they knew that we were having an early start for a day trip to Pompei they handed us a breakfast bag as we raced out the door at 7.00am. The location is brilliant, everything that you could possibly want to see in Rome is within a short distance. Rome is very welcoming for tourists, and it is easily possible to do it on any budget. We plan to return and would only consider the Regno.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great position on the Via del Corso. The famous strip of shops is only a short walk away, as is the Trevi fountain, the Pantheon, and if you dont mind walking a little more, the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. The Breakfast served int eh mornings was adequate but nothing spectacular. The Bell boy was friendly but the front desk staff were average, only helping if asked (eg to ring a taxi!) The rooms were clean and of a comfortable size, but the bathroom was very small and the shower had a curtain that did not go all the way around resulting in all the splashed water ending up on the bathroom floor rather than down the drain. The air conditioning struggled to keep up with the hot Roman days. It is a bit of a walk from the nearest Metro Station (Barberini) so if you are weighed down with the luggage, you would need to take a Taxi, however with the state of Roman Traffic these days, you would still get there before the taxi did on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Mimocuja
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 days. I thought the reviews were good and therefore chose this hotel. A great location for sightseeing. Hotel room was clean and comfortable, with a roof top balcony, (however the outside lights were not working)! If you are disabled, you might want to inform them before your arrival. This hotel has six floors , and there can be quite a walk to the other side of the hotel. Staff were friendly, and assisted in translation (italian/english). Had a great time overall, very close to the Trevi fountain. Fill your purse/wallet as Rome is the most expensive city I have ever visited, but it was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, convenient and so friendly!”
Reviews.Author: gyinnit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend at the end of July 2005 for 3 nights. We went to Rome as neither of us had ever been and we are so glad that we picked the Regno! We couldn't believe we were so centrally positioned. Each night we would go to the Trevi fountain on the way back to the hotel after dinner as it was so near the hotel and look at all the people gathered there doing the same thing....even at midnight! The room was fairly large for a typical european hotel. The TV had international news channels so we could keep up to date with what was happening in the world. As we were starting early each day, it was useful having the breakfast there so we would pick up a croissant/ donut on our way out. With such a good location, we found that we could see a particular attraction and then go back to the hotel to rest for a while before going out for more (especially useful in the heat!) sightseeing. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be returning! The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the receptionist reserved some tickets to the Borghese gallery for us, no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: zygo
Reviews.Content: Good value Perfect position on main road for sites shops and restaurants Rooms pleasantly decorated and clean Good breakfast Staff very friendly with sense of humour and especially sympathetic and helpful when we had to cut short our holiday due to family bereavement Would definitely return Slight drawback some rooms little small but moved on request to larger

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: barbara06248
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Regno in June, 2004 and we thought it was perfect for our needs. It is small, but new, clean, and comes with breakfast every morning. THe staff are friendly, courteous, and willing to help and assist. You can't beat the location. You step out your door and the buses are right in front of the hotel. Your are 3 small blocks to the trevi on foot, literally across the street, and you are 3 small blocks to the pantheon as well. You have great shopping right on via del corso also. Also, can walk to the Spanish steps, which is maybe a 10-15 min walk past the Trevi and also can walk to the forum and coleseum as well. Enjoy it! It's a great place. In fact, I'm going again July 1, 2005 and I'm staying at the same place with my Honey Pie. lol

Reviews.Title: “You can't miss!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) can just add to all the great reviews written about this hotel. We stayed fri-mon in the middle of June and had a GREAT stay. First of all, you can't beat the location: right there on Via del Corso, the best shopping street in Rome. We could walk to all the major sights (Vatican: 25 mins, Coloseum 10 mins, Trevi Fountain 2 mins, Spanish steps 5 mins, Pantheon 2 mins). The hotel's restaurant is small, but cosy, with a simple but tasty breakfast. The "snack bar menu" for the afternoon is much bigger than you can imagine (alltough eating out is recommended). The staff was excellent, with great knowledge of the city an very service-minded. The room was italian-style with all the things you want, and the windows towards the street are almost sound-proof. Next time we go to Rome (and we will), we won't even consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eur2005
Reviews.Content: I just came back, I love it, we have a balcony with view to plaza popolo and Victor Emanuelle Monument. If i return to rome, I will repeat the experience. Is walking distance to everywhere in Rome. The employees were so nice. They know you.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our Italian adventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four adults just came back from a vacation to Italy. Rome was our last stop on this trip, and Regno Hotel was our last hotel. It was the best of all of the various hotels we had stayed on our vacation. We had a very large room, with a queen bed and two twin beds. The room was beautifully done, with a minibar and tv that had CNN and BBC in English so we could catch up on the news. The bathroom was spacious and had all of the toiletries we needed. Breakfast was lovely and there were many options for the five days we were there. The staff was patient and kind, answering the many questions we had about our time in Rome. They set up a taxi to come pick us up and take us to the airport on the day of our departure. The location was excellent, only a fifteen minute walk to the Roman Forum and the Collosseum, minutes away from the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain and Piazza Venezia (most of the buses stop at that square, so very easy to get to other parts of the city). I highly recommend this hotel; it made the last leg of our vacation quite enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean and well maintained. Our room on the 5th floor was rather small, but more than made up for it by having a small terrace. Lovely to sit out late in the evening, enjoying a drink from the mini-bar and soaking up the atmosphere of a perfect Roman evening. Very close to the Trevi Fountain (which we visited at least twice a day), the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Il Vittoriale (Victor Emanuele Monument) and Forum/Colosseo also very close. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, breakfast pretty standard but lots of it and the coffee is very good indeed. Would recommend it to anyone, and will definitely stay there again when we return (and I have thrown lots of euros into the Trevi just to make sure).

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: UkKatie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an absolutely unbeatable location in Rome right on the Vila De Corso. We could walk to the Pantheon in 5 mins, the Trevi Fountain in 5mins, the Spanish Steps in 10 mins and the Colloseum in approx 15 mins. The rooms are no frills but comfortable and clean. The hotel staff were all extremely helpful and accomodating and the breakfast buffet was also excellent value. I would reccomend the Hotel Regno as the perfect city break hotel in an amazing position to see this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Good staff”
Reviews.Author: JLongo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Regno. We booked it because of their affiliation with American Airlines, and used mileage for half the cost of our stay. It is a perfect location, we walked everywhere except when we went to the Vatican. For visits to the Vatican, there is a bus stop just outside the hotel and it takes you right there! The front desk staff was helpful at explaining how to do the bus, and with recommending restaurants. The breakfast is a typical European continental breakfast with a woman there who makes a GREAT cappucino. It was the best cappucino I had the whole time in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good bargain”
Reviews.Author: 0Odisseus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were given a bright room on the 5th floor, right on Via del Corso. There was a safe in the room and a brand new marbled bathroom. The double bed turned out to be twin beds put together, but we had no difficulty sleeping well... The location is just next to the Senate, in the middle of everything! I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Sues51
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed 3 nights at the Regno and would stay here again. I was there with my aunt (85) and we enjoyed our stay greatly. Our room was not at all small and we faced onto via del corso, noisy until about midnight at the latest and then very quite. They do come to do your room early but it was done for us one morning when we got back from breakfast!! You can eat as much or as little as you want at breakfast. Very central for walking to the sites or taking the buses which you catch just by the hotel (1e). I would recommend this hotel for anyone any age. English is either spoken or understood by everyone we spoke to in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for a Short Break”
Reviews.Author: munkypete
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about choosing a two star property but the Regno was perfect. Slap bang in the middle of town, easy walking distance to all the main sites. We even walked from the main train station, but got a taxi for the return, Rome is so hot in August. The hotel rooms were very small, but clean and nicely appointed. Separate shower/wash room and separate toilet. We had a balcony (again small) to watch the world go by. Good sound protection from the outside. The hotel was very busy in August and the breakfast room was a little crammed. My only poor comment would be to say that the staff were a little slow at clearing the breakfast tables (of departed guests) and several mornings we cleared our own table to be able to eat. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. If I ever go back to Rome, I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Regno for 5 nights in March 2005. All major sights are within easy walking distance and hotel is clean and well maintained. Staff are helpful and speak good English. Our room was a little on the small side but they did offer to find us a bigger one if we were unhappy...we chose to stay where we were. I would definitely recommend this for a 'no frills' functional hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Regno twice. Both times we have found the hotel and staff to be great. Our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great central location. Breakfast is great. We would definately stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: gfmstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really incredible. While not a lavish 5+ star hotel, it has an incredible location on Via del Corso. Many of the major attractions of Rome are no more than a 5 to 15 minute walk! Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps. The staff are all helpful, and all speak excellent English. We saw reviews about the rooms being small, but we were assigned a room that was almost a junior suite, with a balcony(ask for room 134). Room is well equipped, has an honor bar/refrig. Even though on top of busy street, room is well soundproofed. We went in late Feb, and got a rate of $660USD(all taxes, etc, plus breakfast) for 5 nights which was less than what it would have cost to go to Los Angeles. Right out the front of the hotel, are 2 bus stops(both directions) that will take you almost anywhere in Rome, or where you can make a connection. Coming into Termini from Fiumicino, take the 175 bus to the Minghetti stop on del Corso- hotel across the street. Cant get any easier. If you aren't in the market for a super expensive international hotel, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: gooddaughter
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Hotel Regno. It was so close to all the major attractions of Rome, along with the shopping areas and good restaurants. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful to me as they all speak very good English and didn't mind answering my questions. The rooms were small, but thats typical in Europe. They were very clean and neat. The location was absolutely perfect - I would definitely stay there again if I ever go back to Rome. And the Italians in general were lovely people. What a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Bel Regno”
Reviews.Author: Oztrekker
Reviews.Content: Back today after 4 enjoyable nights at the Regno. If you could pinpoint a central location this is it! Everything (apart from Vatican area) is within easy walking distance but it is the hospitality of the staff that make this hotel - reception, cleaning, bar/breakfast - everybody is so so nice! The rooms are immaculate and yes, some of them are small but the staff cater and read your every need (we had an usually cold spell and threw an extra cover over and next day the beds were made with extra covers). Towels whiter than white. Breakfast ample. Would recommend this hotel to anyone (some renovation going on at the moment - not that you notice any noise or disruption) Say hallo to Gabrielle - he is a sweetie!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City Break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a one week stay at the Regno after reading good reviews on this site, and when I got there I was not disappointed. The holiday was to celebrate my father in laws 60th birthday as he had always wanted to visit Rome. His requirements were a central location, walking distance to all the major attractions, a clean, tidy and friendly hotel and ofcourse at a good price, Although the hotel is small it met all of his criteria and we all had a lovely holiday. The rooms were small but clean and decorated well, both our rooms had a balcony which is a must for a view and ofcourse if your a smoker (no smoking in the rooms)! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be at the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regno Center of Excitement!”
Reviews.Author: DecorateOrnate
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regno is located on Via del Corso, which is the best of locations! My daughter and I stayed there in May 2004, and we loved it. Our room was small, but very nice. We had our own window with balcony which over looks del Corso. Look out your window to the right and you see the beautiful bldg with the chariots on top, and walk just across the street and you have a bank for ATM. Walk just beside the bank side street and you will run into the "Trevi Fountain" The breakfast buffet is delicious and has a wide selection of foods with juice, etc. The staff is above excellence. They are so friendly and helpful with anything we asked. They helped us with any place we desired to see. We just loved our experience there. You are in walking distance of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Via del Conditti which is wonderful shopping. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Really terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regno for four nights in January 2005 and found both the service, cleanliness, and help to be outstanding. On the first night we had a little problem with the room and the next morning the reception person moved us into another room with no hassle. All the staff were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and things to do and see. We will always stay at the Regno. Oh, this is our sixth trip to Rome and this hotel is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regno”
Reviews.Author: Lambsy03
Reviews.Content: I will never forget the wonderful time we had in Rome and part of that experience was the Regno. Yes the rooms were a little small and the bathroom was a little cramped but everything was clean and tidy and had so much charm. (Outside our window was a busker playing the accordion, it was like a scene from a movie) The staff were wonderful, the breakfasts of pastries, fruits, etc were to die for, and I have yet to experience a cappuccino to equal Regno's. The proximity to the beautiful Fontana di Trevi and the mesmerising Pantheon only enhanced my stay in Rome. I have left my heart there, one day I will return to collect it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regno”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel not receiving notification of our booking (via British Airways) & being "full up" we were allocated an upgraded suite (at no extra cost)which was superbly decorated & furnished. Breakfast was all you could ask for and the location ...well you won't find anywhere more in the centre of attractions & shops. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “hope you have lots of money!!”
Reviews.Author: chickie2
Reviews.Content: When arriving in fco airport rome DO NOT use taxi's they charged us 87 euros to our hotel when returning i used airport shuttle and for 2 people it was 29 euros. Hotel was situated on via del corso everything was within walking distance fab!! Lovely helpful staff but street and fellow guests were heard 24/7 there was no escape. When visiting all major attractions colleseum the pope etc. you MUST pay 4 a tour guide to explain monuments etc as there is no other source of information,this obviously is costly anything upto 80 euros each. Highlight of the trip a man called TONY at the colleseum there is nothing he doesnt know about the roman empire you can listen to him 4 hrs!!
